listing_jobDesc: listing_jobDesc
listing_jobDesc
listing_jobDesc

Note: you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand in order to be considered for this role. If relocating to Christchurch, we can assist with moving and setup costs.
About us
Partly is an early-stage startup on a mission to connect the world's parts. There is currently a huge, mostly unsolved problem within the industry - linking a part to the vehicles it fits (often hundreds) is incredibly time consuming, often impossible. This is the problem we're solving, and involves structuring millions of vehicles, hundreds of millions of parts, and billions of links. We use a number of bleeding edge technologies to do this (dGraph graph database, Kafka event streaming, etc).
We were founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers and raised our Seed round from Blackbird Ventures (Canva, CultureAmp etc.), Hillfarrance, IceHouse Ventures and Peter Beck (RocketLab Founder).
We have 2 main products: PartsPal (https://www.partly.com/software/partspal), a SaaS tool that makes it easy for parts businesses to sell online; and Partly API (https://www.partly.com/software/partlyapi), which larger parts businesses and developers use to structure their data and get online. This is a $1.9 trillion industry, and solving this problem makes a huge difference for our customers.
The team at Partly are young and ambitious, and continually striving to improve. We are expanding globally, and offering you an exciting opportunity to grow your career alongside us, develop your skills and have fun doing it.
About the role
In this role, you will help lead the Data side of the business and work closely with our CEO and Senior Strategic Data Engineer. You will be joining a team of incredibly ambitious and talented engineers and data scientists to tackle hard, exciting problems and build beautiful software.
Qualifications & experience
Strong experience with scraping, indexing and cleaning large complex datasets
Strong experience with data mining
Strong experience with entity resolution
Strong experience with structuring, and processing unstructured data
Strong bonus: experience in the automotive parts industry
Bonus: experience with graph databases and ontology, or clustering algorithms
Bonus: be based (or willing to move) to Christchurch
Tasks & responsibilities
Validating and linking different parts, brands, and vehicle definitions
Designing and implementing our ingestion pipelines
Using implicit relations to link part data across countries
Benefits
Salary
Stock options (at Pre-Seed exercise price)
Flexible work hours
Team social events
Brand new office

Free snacks and coffee machine Note: you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand in order to be considered for this role. If relocating to Christchurch, we can assist with moving and setup costs.

New Zealand’s leading hospital laboratory
Full-time permanent role
Dedicated friendly team

Due to service expansion we are looking for an experienced and motivated Medical Laboratory Scientist to join our Microarray team. This is an excellent opportunity to work with NZ’s largest and highly specialised hospital based laboratory service.
Ko wai mātou | Our Organisation
At Te Toka Tumai | Auckland DHB we are committed to upholding Te Tiriti o Waitangi and providing culturally safe care. We value role modelling manaakitanga as demonstrated by Ngāti Whātua in the gifting of their whenua on which our hospitals stand. We aspire to having a workforce reflective of the communities we serve and achieving equitable outcomes for all.
LabPLUS is an IANZ accredited medical laboratory and is one of New Zealand's premier laboratories. LabPLUS are part of the state-owned Auckland District Health Board. We offer a comprehensive pathology service for Auckland City Hospital, Starship Children’s Hospital, National Women's Health, and the Greenlane Clinical Centre. LabPLUS is also a major referral laboratory for specialised laboratory tests for New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. Visit our website www.labplus.co.nz for more information.
The Diagnostic Genetics laboratory provides a comprehensive service using both cytogenetic and molecular genetics techniques enabling us to resolve clinical diagnoses with a genetic component. We analyse pre and post-natal samples, providing predictive testing, and confirmation of a clinical diagnosis in the management of a spectrum of both malignant and inherited disorders. Our portfolio of tests is constantly being upgraded with a view to reducing turnaround times and enhancing our tests to take into account new technologies and approaches in line with international clinical and research data.
The Microarray team uses chromosomal microarray analysis (CMA) to identify gains and losses of genomic material that are related to clinical phenotypes. Testing is provided for a wide range of clinical indications for both prenatal and postnatal referrals.
Te whiwhinga mahi | The Opportunity
In this role, you will perform laboratory processing of patient specimens for chromosomal microarray analysis, analyse and interpret the CMA results, including the curation of genomic findings, and prepare clinical reports based on your analysis. The above tasks will be delivered to the high quality required for diagnostic genetic analysis and produced in a timely manner in line with clinical requirements. Although this role is primarily based in the Microarray team, you may be required to work in any section of the diagnostic genetics laboratory.

For more information please contact Karen Claxton, Section Leader on KClaxton@adhb.govt.nz
Nga Pūkenga Motuhake | Important Skills
To be successful in this role you will have the following skills and attributes:-
Qualified Medical Laboratory Scientist registered with the Medical Sciences Council of NZ and current APC.
Previous experience in a medical laboratory carrying out molecular diagnostic techniques is essential.
A methodical and organised approach to work with a keen focus on accuracy and data quality.
Good knowledge of the ISO15189 standards.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Flexibility to suit the service demands with the ability to prioritise and deliver to deadlines.
Working knowledge of computer based systems within the context of a Medical Laboratory.

He aha ngā painga o tēnei mahi mōu | Why you will enjoy working here
Here is what we can offer you -
A unique and rewarding work environment that provides a high level of job satisfaction and is always interesting
An opportunity to grow both as a person and as a professional while working with a very friendly team with a great team environment and supportive work culture
Comprehensive and well-structured orientation programme with good clinical support to help you achieve the orientation competencies.
Continuing Professional Development opportunities
Structured process of performance evaluation
Discounts at a variety of businesses, free eye test
Opportunity to work with some of the best in business!

For more information on what we offer, please click here
Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to apply
Please click on the ‘Apply’ tab below and submit your application online attaching your updated CV and Covering Letter. Please submit your application online, outlining your experience and motivation to apply to this role.
For help with your application please email, Hamish Watson, Recruitment Consultant on HamishWats@adhb.govt.nz quoting ref # ADHB14286
Closing date is 22 August 2022.

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

Your Impact:
Our bodies and environment all depend on water, it is the building block that supports all life. Water issues are becoming increasingly prominent as we struggle with disparity between water availability and demands, water pollution, and competition for limited water resources. At Jacobs, our scientists, engineers, and planners are working together with clients to find the right solutions to their water challenges.
A career at Jacobs provides you with the opportunity to make a positive impact and deliver solutions that bring value to our communities, and society as a whole. With a workforce of 55,000 operating across much of the globe, we use our Solutions and Technology framework to provide technical development to our staff, which then enables us to develop innovative ideas to solve our client’s challenges. Our water business provides the full spectrum of consulting services from advisory and engineering through to operations and asset management.
On top of the exposure to challenging projects and career development opportunities, we offer competitive remuneration packages and multiple staff benefits such as paid parental and partner leave, purchase leave, and mental health & wellbeing programs, to name a few. We also support a plethora of flexible working practices such as flexible start/end times, job share arrangements, working from home, and part-time arrangements.
About the role
We are looking for a Hydrologist and Flood modeller to help us deliver a strong pipeline of work on high profile and challenging projects for Water and Infrastructure (ie. road, rail, power) clients across Australia and New Zealand. Our team contribute to the whole value chain of water resource management, including data collection, environmental approvals, compliance monitoring/reporting, infrastructure design and advisory to Government in the development of policy.
The purpose of this role is to contribute to hydrology and flood modelling investigations and to collaboratively work with other disciplines on both small and large as well as simple and complex projects. You will have some experience in developing models, analysing and interpreting data, and presenting it a way that effectively communicates your evidence and recommendations so that our clients can make decisions. You will have knowledge of legislation and policies relevant to hydrology and flood modelling, and be equipped to work collaboratively with other disciplines to ensure successful delivery of multidisciplinary infrastructure projects.
You will work with a team of passionate scientists and engineers who truly value diversity and technical excellence and come from backgrounds in the private and public sectors, as well as academia. We will support you with your career ambitions through mentoring, formal and informal training, and attendance at conferences. We have an ANZ-wide annual promotions process, which provides a transparent framework for career progression, and enables direct conversations about performance and the value you are adding to our clients and wider team.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
You will be responsible for:
Contributing to a range of hydrology and flood modelling projects, and leading smaller, less complex tasks and projects.
Preparation of risk assessments and method statements, data collation and analysis.
Teaching, coaching and mentoring less-experienced team members.
Clearly communicating progress and any issues with project delivery with the project team, and in some instances, clients.
Presenting information to clients and stakeholders at meetings in a concise and effective manner.
Authoring complex assessments / reports.
Managing tasks and simple projects so that they are delivered on time, within budget, and to the agreed quality.
Jacobs. A world where you can.
From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. By supporting one another, we all succeed.
With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.
At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.
Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.

With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.
At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.
Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.
#LI-DMC1 Show more

Do you want a career where you can make a real difference? One with an organization where intellectual curiosity, focus, and hard work are rewarded with opportunity? An organization known for doing things differently and providing practical, effective, and long-term solutions? At EHS Support, we take pride in doing important work that has a lasting impact. Here we define success by what our people achieve through the effective application of science, communication, and a lot of hard work. If you’re just looking for a job, we are not your company. On the other hand, if you want to fix real problems…if you want to learn, grow, and evolve…then EHS Support is the company for you.
What are the perks of joining EHS Support? We offer career programming to help you grow your expertise within the industry, work from home positions with equipment provided, relocation assistance opportunities, work abroad programs, performance bonuses and competitive compensation
Location: Work from Home position (Auckland preferred)
Typical responsibilities will include:
Supporting soil and groundwater contamination investigations, due diligence, and remediation projects.
Collection and reporting of field data including sampling of surface water, soil groundwater, vapour and ground gas.
Sampling of hazardous materials (including asbestos) in buildings.
Data handling and analysis.
Travel and participation in field activities.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Qualities required for success in our team:
Flexibility and ability to manage multiple deadlines and fast-changing priorities.
Display integrity through honesty, fairness, & respect.
Possesses a sense of responsibility and takes accountability.
Takes initiative and can work both as part of a team and individually.
Maintains a sense of ownership over delivery of projects.
Has a desire to develop a knowledge of the New Zealand contaminated land regulatory framework.
Trustworthy & dependable.
Good listener & fosters teamwork.

Skills required for success in this role include:
2-3 years of direct experience in environmental data collection, contaminated land preliminary and detailed site investigations, and remedial oversight, with a foundation in technical and regulatory subject areas. Education, training, and experience in earth sciences (geology, hydrogeology, environmental chemistry etc.) is desirable.
We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. At a glance:
Ref: 42644 | Hamilton (Newstead) | Agricultural/Environmental, Chemistry, Genetics, Laboratory Technician, Molecular Biology, Microbiology, Reproduction, Research & Development, Science | Experienced | Fixed term, Full Time | Scientist (direct reports) 210921.pdf
About Us

We all have our improvement stories to tell. At LIC we believe in constant improvement, never settling and always striving for greatness. We know little improvements can add up to huge gains for our customers, and for our country. We value NZ primary industries and will do what it takes to support and grow our farmer community. We're down to earth and we're a diverse bunch - a mix of super smart scientists, veterinarians, farmers, salespeople and clever marketing folk. We are inclusive and count ourselves lucky to have people from all backgrounds working with us.

LIC is based in Newstead, Hamilton, where we enjoy more affordable housing, relaxed commuting, easy parking and a readily accessible outdoor lifestyle. Our campus is in a rural setting just outside Hamilton and includes a social club, swimming pool, onsite parking, tennis and volleyball courts and a café with great coffee. We also offer extra leave days per year, family leave for new parents, discounted insurance, employee shares scheme, mental health & well-being program, internal training programmes and an employee assistance programme to name but a few - and we're still working on improvements!

About the Role

We have an exciting opportunity for a Scientist in Molecular Genetics, to join our innovative Research and Development group. There you will be an integral part of our world-leading research group, with a focus on the application of genetics to real-world outcomes. If you are excited about using your knowledge of genetics to apply our research to the development of new products and services, then please apply! You will work with one of the largest whole-genome sequence and microarray datasets in the southern hemisphere and lead the delivery of research and services that improve on-farm outcomes and animal health. If working with massive biological datasets to answer biological questions and personally deliver tangible outcomes interests you, we'd love to hear from you!

Based in Hamilton you would be part of a wider Research and Development team who are working in the areas of genetics, genomics, breeding scheme design, animal welfare, methane reduction, machine learning, and pasture measurement from satellites.

Applicants will display the following attributes:

A PhD in a relevant biological field with experience in industry or academia
Experience with microarray design and analysis, and the analysis sequence data
Knowledge of Bioinformatics, and/or statistical analysis
Computational skills in Linux, Bash, R or Python and SQL would be a significant asset
Excellent communications and coordination skills for working with diverse groups

Experience leading a small team or research projects would be an advantage, you will need to be organised and enjoy working across a range of research and business areas.

How to Apply

If you're after a rewarding and social career that offers development, learning and truckloads of exceptional experiences then look no further, you've found it. At LIC we are leading the way and we would love to welcome you to the team.

For more information and to apply, go to our website https://careers.lic.co.nz/home

Job code: 42644

Applications Close: 24 August 2022, however we will be assessing applications as they come in, and the role may close early if a suitable candidate is found. Show more

Description
Purpose: Conducts and monitors trials to characterize the field performance of new chemistry compounds and product concepts, in line with a global research program provided by the relevant Field Sciences Centers of Expertise (CoE), following all company stewardship guidelines. Provides input into globally driven protocols, summarizes data at the local level and contributes to global data summaries in line with established Research Cycle processes. Provides local knowledge on crop management practices, issues and trends to Field Sciences teams as well as the commercial organization. Reports to the ANZ Field Sciences Leader.
Key responsibilities and accountabilities:
Accountable for flawless field trial execution: Working to approved biology plans, understanding and writing of protocols, forecasting sample needs and organizing shipments of test items. In conjunction with Research Centre Leader, is accountable for overseeing exact planning of trial crops, crop inputs and their maintenance, managing disease and insect requirements for trials. Is responsible for test item application, disease inoculations and evaluations as well as timely upload of data to pertinent data bases.
Prepares trial and interim data summaries for in-house and virtual field tours and participates in external customer field tours as required.
Meets all requirements of regulatory operating permits and completes all internal Safety Standard documentation as required.
Works with Regulatory specialists to ensure that all trial work is done in compliance with local regulations.
Summarizes data from individual trials for Key Answer files, multiple trials for Protocol Summary Files and presents data to Field Sciences stakeholders.
May assist CoE and Zonal Biology Leaders in local data generation for pipeline and existing products to ensure optimal technical value propositions for final products and cost-efficient trial plans.
Measures and documents field performance, understands resistance issues, and identifies trends and issues relative to the ongoing agronomic operation of the research center.
Meets all administrative requirements, including resource, time, and expense reporting.
May serve as a technical expert for specific products and crops in the assigned territory.
May represent the company at relevant academic and government institutes in the assigned territory, understands emerging trends and technology related to agriculture.
May serve as focal point for Field Sciences locally and/or globally pertaining to technical issues and queries related to the assigned products.
May work with the Digital Innovation team in Field Sciences to provide technical support, input and testing of next-generation pest control and agricultural practices.
May help supervise and provide input to special projects or post-graduate student projects run at the Research Centre.

Location and Travel: Role will be based at Waireka Research Centre in Omata, New Plymouth, Taranaki.
Travel may be required to off-site trial locations, relevant industry events and internal team meetings.


Qualifications

Broad scientific and agronomic understanding and project leadership.
BSc or higher in Plant Pathology, Entomology or Agricultural Sciences, with demonstratable practical experience in the execution and management of field trials.
Ability to make sound decisions based on best available information.
Excellent understanding of trial design, statistics, data analysis and presentation.
Versatile individual who can solve practical problems and is highly committed to a strong safety and stewardship culture.
Ability to interact with local and global team members. Excellent English communication skills. Description

Note: you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand in order to be considered for this role. If relocating to Christchurch, we can assist with moving and setup costs.
About us
Partly is an early-stage startup on a mission to connect the world's parts. There is currently a huge, mostly unsolved problem within the industry - linking a part to the vehicles it fits (often hundreds) is incredibly time consuming, often impossible. This is the problem we're solving, and involves structuring millions of vehicles, hundreds of millions of parts, and billions of links. We use a number of bleeding edge technologies to do this (dGraph graph database, Kafka event streaming, etc).
We were founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers and raised our Seed round from Blackbird Ventures (Canva, CultureAmp etc.), Hillfarrance, IceHouse Ventures and Peter Beck (RocketLab Founder).
We have 2 main products: PartsPal (https://www.partly.com/software/partspal), a SaaS tool that makes it easy for parts businesses to sell online; and Partly API (https://www.partly.com/software/partlyapi), which larger parts businesses and developers use to structure their data and get online. This is a $1.9 trillion industry, and solving this problem makes a huge difference for our customers.
The team at Partly are young and ambitious, and continually striving to improve. We are expanding globally, and offering you an exciting opportunity to grow your career alongside us, develop your skills and have fun doing it.
About the role
In this role, you will help lead the Data side of the business and work closely with our CEO. You will be joining a team of incredibly ambitious and talented engineers and data scientists to tackle hard, exciting problems and build beautiful software.
Qualifications & experience
Strong experience with complex datasets, and relationships
Strong experience with complex multi-dependency data ingestion / merge pipelines
Strong experience with highly relational data / graph data structures / graph databases
Strong experience cleaning, extracting, and mapping real-world entities
Experience with ETL/ELT pipelines
Bonus: Experience with merging and tracking multiple datasets
Bonus: Experience with entity resolution
Bonus: Experience with Hadoop, Flume or similar data transformation tools
Bonus: Experience with knowledge graphs or expert systems
Strong bonus: experience in the automotive parts industry
Bonus: be based (or willing to move) to Christchurch
Tasks & responsibilities
Using models to validate and link different parts, brands, and vehicle definitions
Designing and implementing our knowledge graph
Using implicit relations to link part data across countries
Benefits
Salary
Stock options (at Pre-Seed exercise price)
Flexible work hours
Team social events
Brand new office
Free snacks and coffee machine Note: you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand in order to be considered for this role. If relocating to Christchurch, we can assist with moving and setup costs.

We use a number of bleeding edge technologies to do this (dGraph graph database, Kafka event streaming, etc).
We were founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers and raised our Seed round from Blackbird Ventures (Canva, CultureAmp etc.), Hillfarrance, IceHouse Ventures and Peter Beck (RocketLab Founder).
We have 2 main products: PartsPal (https://www.partly.com/software/partspal), a SaaS tool that makes it easy for parts businesses to sell online; and Partly API (https://www.partly.com/software/partlyapi), which larger parts businesses and developers use to structure their data and get online. This is a $1.9 trillion industry, and solving this problem makes a huge difference for our customers.
The team at Partly are young and ambitious, and continually striving to improve. We are expanding globally, and offering you an exciting opportunity to grow your career alongside us, develop your skills and have fun doing it.
About the role
In this role, you will help lead the Data side of the business and work closely with our CEO. You will be joining a team of incredibly ambitious and talented engineers and data scientists to tackle hard, exciting problems and build beautiful software.
Qualifications & experience
Strong experience with complex datasets, and relationships
Strong experience with complex multi-dependency data ingestion / merge pipelines
Strong experience with highly relational data / graph data structures / graph databases
Strong experience cleaning, extracting, and mapping real-world entities
Experience with ETL/ELT pipelines
Bonus: Experience with merging and tracking multiple datasets
Bonus: Experience with entity resolution
Bonus: Experience with Hadoop, Flume or similar data transformation tools
Bonus: Experience with knowledge graphs or expert systems
Strong bonus: experience in the automotive parts industry
Bonus: be based (or willing to move) to Christchurch
Tasks & responsibilities
Using models to validate and link different parts, brands, and vehicle definitions
Designing and implementing our knowledge graph
Using implicit relations to link part data across countries
Benefits
Salary
Stock options (at Pre-Seed exercise price)
Flexible work hours
Team social events
Brand new office
Free snacks and coffee machine Note: you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand in order to be considered for this role. If relocating to Christchurch, we can assist with moving and setup costs.
About us
Partly is an early-stage startup on a mission to connect the world's parts. There is currently a huge, mostly unsolved problem within the industry - linking a part to the vehicles it fits (often hundreds) is incredibly time consuming, often impossible. This is the problem we're solving, and involves structuring millions of vehicles, hundreds of millions of parts, and billions of links. We use a number of bleeding edge technologies to do this (dGraph graph database, Kafka event streaming, etc).
We were founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers and raised our Seed round from Blackbird Ventures (Canva, CultureAmp etc.), Hillfarrance, IceHouse Ventures and Peter Beck (RocketLab Founder).
We have 2 main products: PartsPal (https://www.partly.com/software/partspal), a SaaS tool that makes it easy for parts businesses to sell online; and Partly API (https://www.partly.com/software/partlyapi), which larger parts businesses and developers use to structure their data and get online. This is a $1.9 trillion industry, and solving this problem makes a huge difference for our customers.
The team at Partly are young and ambitious, and continually striving to improve. We are expanding globally, and offering you an exciting opportunity to grow your career alongside us, develop your skills and have fun doing it.
About the role
In this role, you will help lead the Data side of the business and work closely with our CEO. You will be joining a team of incredibly ambitious and talented engineers and data scientists to tackle hard, exciting problems and build beautiful software.
Qualifications & experience

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist, Diagnostic Genetics LabPLUS
listing_jobDesc:
New Zeaand’s leading hospital laboratory
Part-time permanent role
Dedicated friendly team

Ko wai mātou | Our Organisation
At Te Toka Tumai | Auckland DHB we are committed to upholding Te Tiriti o Waitangi and providing culturally safe care. We value role modelling manaakitanga as demonstrated by Ngāti Whātua in the gifting of their whenua on which our hospitals stand. We aspire to having a workforce reflective of the communities we serve and achieving equitable outcomes for all.
LabPLUS is an IANZ accredited medical laboratory and is one of New Zealand's premier laboratories. LabPLUS are part of the state-owned Auckland District Health Board. We offer a comprehensive pathology service for Auckland City Hospital, Starship Children’s Hospital, National Women's Health, and the Greenlane Clinical Centre. LabPLUS is also a major referral laboratory for specialised laboratory tests for New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. Visit our website www.labplus.co.nz for more information.
The Diagnostic Genetics laboratory provides a comprehensive service using both cytogenetic and molecular genetics techniques enabling us to resolve clinical diagnoses with a genetic component. We analyse pre and post-natal samples, providing predictive testing, and confirmation of a clinical diagnosis in the management of a spectrum of both malignant and inherited disorders. Our portfolio of tests is constantly being upgraded with a view to reducing turnaround times and enhancing our tests to take into account new technologies and approaches in line with international clinical and research data.
Te whiwhinga mahi | The Opportunity
This is a part time role working 28 hours per week (0.7)
In this role, you will perform laboratory analyses and associated tasks ensuring delivery of high quality and timely services in line with clinical expectations with an overall emphasis on quality outcomes. Although this role is based in the Cytogenetics section of our department, you may be required to work in any section of the Diagnostic Genetics laboratory.
For more information about this position please contact Pippa Grainger, Scientist Unit Manager, Diagnostic Genetics, LabPLUS on pgrainger@adhb.govt.nz or Emilie Parkes, Section Leader of Cytogenetics, Diagnostic Genetics, LabPlus on emiliep@adhb.govt.nz.

Nga Pūkenga Motuhake | Important Skills

To be successful in this role you will have the following skills and attributes:-
Qualified Medical Laboratory Scientist registered with the Medical Sciences Council of NZ and hold a current APC.
Previous work experience in a diagnostic medical laboratory with practical experience in cytogenetic techniques, including karyotyping and FISH.
Molecular genetics experience would also be beneficial, specifically QF-PCR.
A methodical and organised approach to work with a keen focus on accuracy and data quality.
Awareness and understanding of the ISO15189 standards.
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to work well within a team.
Flexibility to suit the service demands with the ability to prioritise and deliver to deadlines.
Have a passion for excellent service delivery with high quality outputs.

We are a values based and inclusive organisation that is committed to deliver the best health outcomes for our total population. To do this we are working hard to develop a robust and capable workforce that reflects the population we serve. We strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds with the necessary capability and who share our values to apply and would greatly value seeing more applicants from our Māori & Pacific communities. Our organisation values diversity, inclusivity and empathy. If you do too, apply now and join us to make a positive difference and to “do your life’s best work at Auckland DHB”.
He aha ngā painga o tēnei mahi mōu | Why you will enjoy working here
Auckland District Health Board (Auckland DHB) is one of the leading healthcare providers in New Zealand offering a wide range of tertiary and quaternary clinical services to a large and diverse population. We have state of the art facilities and provide our services from three hospitals – Auckland City Hospital, Starship Children’s Health and Greenlane Clinical Centre.
For more information on what we offer, please click here

Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to apply
Please click on the ‘Apply’ tab below and submit your application online attaching your updated CV and Covering Letter. Please submit your application online, outlining your experience and motivation to apply to this role.
For help with your application please email, Hamish Watson, Recruitment Consultant on HamishWats@adhb.govt.nz quoting ref # ADHB15296
Closing date is 26 August 2022.

About the role

A true desire to innovate – your ideas will be used and tested in the projects you work on
Collaborate with talented teams of data scientists, engineers and analysts
Join a progressive organisation with the people and policies you want

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Lead Data Scientist to join our Data and Analytics team.

As a Lead Data Scientist you’ll not only be joining a great team - you’ll be joining a large community of Data professionals, with the scale and ambition to keep growing. And right now, our Data community is on an exciting journey. Harnessing the power of Data is a strategic priority across the bank, which is why we have a roadmap in place to make us New Zealand’s leading Data driven organisation. There’s a constant drive to push the boundaries of how data and analytics are applied - we’re serious about letting our data professionals use their skills to deliver meaningful impact. Being part of ANZ means playing a part in this change and shaping the future of data at the bank – which means lots of opportunity to broaden your skill set and progress your data career.

Location: Wellington or Auckland

What will your day look like

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
You will spend your day using your expertise and knowledge of best practice to ensure customers’ needs are met through the design and delivery of appropriate advanced analytics solutions that deliver value and enable better decision making.
You will contribute to the innovation, development and adoption of new analytics data, tooling and processes to ensure our analytics practice is able to mature and scale.
You will support other analytics practitioners by setting the technical direction for the team, providing mentoring and coaching and ensuring quality outputs are produced through peer reviews.
What will you bring?

We need people who are brilliant in their field and who strive to test the boundaries. We’re looking for people with amazing capability who want to help shape the future of Data@ANZ.

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

Expert Statistical Analysis and Modelling skills
10 – 15 years’ experience, including 5 years applying data science in a business environment
A growth mindset and desire to continually learn and share new techniques and ideas
Experienced in Python, R or SQL
Understanding of the data science technology landscape

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture and we actively encourage people to try new things. So if this role interests you and you feel you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So, why join us?

We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter and helping people achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

We support our people by providing a range of flexible working options so they can work in the way that best suits them. We encourage you to talk to us about your need for flexibility and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself.

We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.

Interested in joining us? Click Apply now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

Reference number 19015

Job Posting End Date

25/08/2022, 11.59pm Show more

Mōu | For you

Taturanga Aotearoa Stats NZ are dedicated to diversity, equity, inclusion, health, and wellbeing. We welcome every gender, ethnicity, ability, religion, age, and background and encourage people to be their authentic selves.

Flexible by default, balance life and work commitments
Develop and grow your career (coaching, training, study support, secondments)
Contribute to meaningful work that makes a difference to all people in Aotearoa
3 extra annual leave days (taken during Christmas office closure), see careers site for other benefits and networks
State or the art, brand new 6-star green building in Wellington

Te tūnga | The role
This is a permanent role based in Wellington, Auckland or Christchurch. Reporting to the Director Data Ventures, the Data Scientist is responsible for supporting the transformation of data into valuable data products or services for customers. The role identifies valuable internal and external data sources, designs data processing and analysis, builds models and automation processes, and presents solutions and strategies to help customers uncover insights for their business decisions. Requirements in the role may change with the needs of the organisation.

Nōu te rourou | What you bring
We encourage and consider transferable skills and experience gained from outside of work e.g., cultural, community work, sports, volunteering, or a comparable role in a different sector or industry.

We want to see the following in your application:

Why Tatauranga Aotearoa - Stats NZ is the place for you, why us, and why Government?
Any information about your knowledge and experience, or desire to learn and build knowledge and experience of Te Tiriti, Tikanga, Te Reo and Te Ao Māori, and engagement with Māori;
Examples where you've shown curiosity and taken on new perspectives.
Demonstration of customer centricity and collaboration with others;
Strong technical skills in data analysis and mathematical modeling;
Experience with data science tools (R, Python, etc.) and databases (PostGres, SQL, etc) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure);
At least 2 years of experience in data science or related role.
Experience working in product development with other agile teams would be a plus.

Ko mātou | About Us

Tatauranga Aotearoa - Stats NZ is a Central Government employer of around 1400 people across Aotearoa. We provide data and statistical outputs to support the decisions that the Government, Māori and Iwi organisations, businesses, NGOs and New Zealanders make every day. Our work is About Aotearoa, for Aotearoa - data that improves lives today and for generations to come.

Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to apply
For more information about this role please contact Alice Qiao on email alice.qiao@stats.govt.nz.

We will be screening applications as we receive them. Applications close Friday 26th August 2022 at 11.55pm.

Check out our careers site to find out more about working at Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted, do not contact the Hiring Manager directly, please reach out to jobs@stats.govt.nz

You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job. Pre-employment checks are part of our recruitment process.

Any information about your knowledge and experience, or desire to learn and build knowledge and experience of Te Tiriti, Tikanga, Te Reo and Te Ao Māori, and engagement with Māori;
Examples where you've shown curiosity and taken on new perspectives.
Demonstration of customer centricity and collaboration with others;
Strong technical skills in data analysis and mathematical modeling;
Experience with data science tools (R, Python, etc.) and databases (PostGres, SQL, etc) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure);
At least 2 years of experience in data science or related role.
Experience working in product development with other agile teams would be a plus.

Ko mātou | About Us

Tatauranga Aotearoa - Stats NZ is a Central Government employer of around 1400 people across Aotearoa. We provide data and statistical outputs to support the decisions that the Government, Māori and Iwi organisations, businesses, NGOs and New Zealanders make every day. Our work is About Aotearoa, for Aotearoa - data that improves lives today and for generations to come.

Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to apply
For more information about this role please contact Alice Qiao on email alice.qiao@stats.govt.nz.

We will be screening applications as we receive them. Applications close Friday 26th August 2022 at 11.55pm.

Check out our careers site to find out more about working at Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted, do not contact the Hiring Manager directly, please reach out to jobs@stats.govt.nz

You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job. Pre-employment checks are part of our recruitment process.

As a Senior Data Scientist with Eliiza you will work with other smart and passionate people to deliver high quality data science and ML outcomes to clients. Alongside coaching/mentoring peers, you'll lead data science project elements end to end, from solution design, plan phased delivery to translation of end deliverables!

We're super proud of the work we do! With our diverse range of clients and projects, no day will look the same - but here's a snapshot of some of the recent projects keeping our data science team busy:

NLP - sentiment analysis - social media, chatbot data, error correction
Prediction/Forecasting - prediction of economic growth from transaction, prediction of fraud transactions in real time, prediction of customer behaviour
Information extraction - satellite image analysis, facial recognition, image processing

If you're the right Senior Data Scientist for us, you'll have:

an undergraduate degree in maths, statistics, computer science or a postgraduate in broader disciplines such as the sciences.
commercial data science experience across different industries and organisations
strong consulting experience, either with external clients or internally within an organisation
demonstrated ability to coach/mentor peers with less data science or consulting experience
experienced in handling multiple stakeholders and building strong client relationships
enthusiasm and ability to represent the data science domain in internal/external capacity
experience leading data science project elements end to end, from solution design, plan phased delivery to translation of end deliverables
demonstrated ability to deliver outcomes, prioritise steps and manage a team
ability to communicate your recommendations and insights to non-technical audiences to drive decision making
an understanding of key statistical and machine learning concepts across different areas of data science with the ability to manipulate complex data sets to analyse, visualise and prepare data for modelling
extensive experience using at least one open source data science language such as Python or R, fundamental software engineering skills and an understanding of cloud based services and tools

We value diverse skill-sets, and don't necessarily require that you're skilled with all of the above. If you feel you don't fit all the experience/skills listed above we still encourage you to apply or get in touch.

Why join us?

We know you won't have one job for life. That's why we're building a group of companies across Australia and New Zealand where we can support you to take on new skills and challenges. We want to help you develop in your role or diversify your career pathways via alternate brands.
We want each person to tailor their working conditions whether that be remotely every now and then, or on a permanent basis - we know how to actually do 'flexibility' not just talk about it.
You will get to build your experience and fine tune your skills by working on projects right across Mantel Groups portfolio of clients regardless of where you are based.
We're a fast growing progressive company that centres its focus on a people first culture - did we mention we have just ranked #1 in the 2021 Australia's Best Workplaces list!
You will help establish our destination hubs in New Zealand and influence and foster the development of its culture.
We hire smart people and get out of their way. By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape, we trust you to get the job done.
Naturally, you'll get all the tools you need - a new iPhone or Google phone, a new Macbook Pro or HP Elite, and a lot of branded swag!

Who are we?

Glad you asked! We are Eliiza. Data science. Engineered for scale.

We are a passionate team of data scientists and engineers who apply data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems. Our mission is to create a bright future for businesses and society in a world increasingly influenced by intelligent technologies.

More about us

Mantel Group is an Australian-owned, 'house of brands' company with eight technology businesses; DigIO, Eliiza, Kasna, CMD Solutions, Pretzel Lab, Azenix, Cuusoo & Itty Bitty Apps. Since our inception in 2017, we have grown to a team of over 550 people (aka Mantelorians!) across Australia & New Zealand and have just ranked #1 in the 2021 Australia's Best Workplaces list!

We've built a hybrid approach to remote working where you can spend time in any (or all!) of our awesome hubs providing a space for collaboration across Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane & Magnetic island, (Auckland & Queenstown - watch this space!) meaning you can choose a work model that works best for you!


We don't have a head office, instead have opted for a distributed and diverse leadership team that extends across Australia and New Zealand. We're building both support and leadership roles in New Zealand which creates the opportunity for our people to grow, learn and accelerate career development through executing the Mantel Group NZ Strategy.

Keen to chat?

Click "Apply" to share your details with our talent team, and we'll be in touch.

In the meantime, check out 'how we hire' to find out what's in store if you're successful and get to know us better by visiting our website and following Eliiza on LinkedIn. Delivering a better world.

At AECOM we’re driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world. Our clients count on us to think we without limits and we partner with them on projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, governments, public realm, energy and the environment, to build legacies for generations to come.

Ideas have no borders and this ethos is embedded in our culture. As an undergraduate, you will have the chance to work alongside like-minded professionals and industry leaders on iconic projects that help shape and connect our cities and communities.

The Role

This team provides services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works. They support internal and external clients on a wide variety of projects, but predominantly in road, rail, airports, ports and harbours, flood alleviation, commercial and industrial developments, landslip investigation and remediation. Work on a range of projects, involving work such as:


+ Desk studies, site inspections, rockface surveys and geomorphological mapping

+ Contribute to the planning and procurement of ground investigations

+ Supervise ground investigation fieldwork

+ Geological interpretation and preparation of interpretative reports

+ Analysis of geotechnical data, preparation of ground models, design and reporting on foundations, retaining walls, soil slope stability, earthworks, rock slope stabilisation.

You can review all our job opportunities here . This will give you an understanding of what each role entails, allowing you to match your qualifications & interests with the right position.

Should your application be progressed, we will ask you to specify your preferred role/s at a later stage. We recommend you make note of your preferences now and include them in your cover letter or CV.

Minimum Requirements

+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

+ Demonstrated time management and organisational skills

+ A strong sense of commitment, a willingness to learn, and a desire to work in a dynamic deadline-driven environment

Preferred Qualifications

+ UndertakingvEarth Sciences/Geology degree

Your Development

As an undergraduate, you will have the chance to work alongside graduates, technical experts and industry leaders, gaining exposure to iconic projects that help shape and connect our cities and communities. This will be a fantastic opportunity to build long-term meaningful connections for your career.

We will provide you with support and direction to ensure you have an inspiring and positive placement with us, ready to resume your studies in 2023 with new knowledge and practical insights.

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. Delivering a better world.

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.
KPMG is growing its team of talented technical data and analytics consultants. If you are an experienced Data Engineer, Data Scientist or Business Intelligence Analyst and you believe that you are truly a leader in your field, we’d love to talk to you about joining our outstanding cross-functional team.
The varied and fast-moving nature of the solutions we deliver to our clients will allow you to contribute your expertise, learn from working with other exceptional data specialists and have a direct impact on lifting the data maturity and capability of our clients.
The opportunity:
We are looking for driven and experienced Data & Analytics Consultants to join the Digital Lighthouse team at KPMG in Wellington.
KPMG Digital Lighthouse’s data and analytics talent develops data-driven solutions that solve our clients’ toughest challenges. Lighthouse works with complex client problems and leverages deep domain expertise in data engineering, data science, advanced visualisation, and artificial intelligence to provide unique solutions.
In this role, you will support the wider Digital Lighthouse team on a range of initiatives. You will bring your deep technical expertise to the design and delivery of client engagements.
You will contribute to every step of the project lifecycle from developing and winning proposals to managing project delivery and commercials.
You’ll get to work with our highly experienced Management and Risk Consultants who will help make your solutions land with maximum impact and will help you develop new functional skills.
This is a senior role where you will be a key technical mentor and leader within the team, providing coaching and training to junior team members. You will bring your specialist skills and knowledge, developed over your career, to grow new capabilities in our junior team members
Joining KPMG means joining a talented team of remarkable people who bring innovative thoughts and a natural curiosity to the work they do every day. Everyone has the opportunity to succeed at KPMG; our diverse business requires a broad range of personalities, backgrounds, and perspectives. If you share our passion and have authentic data expertise, there’s a place here for you.
Day to day you will:
Design, build and maintenance of data pipelines, data models, advanced analytical models, and data-driven solutions on cloud-based platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure and AWS
Apply scripting language for ETL (extract, transform, load) processes on structured and non-structured databases
Integrate large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
Coordinate and direct assignments in a manner that meets client timelines, budget and outcome requirements
Identify and proactively respond to new business opportunities to provide added value to clients
Contribute to account management to develop awareness of the client organisation, client’s requirements and the services we can deliver
Ensure effective use and application of core KPMG methodologies for which training will be provided on a regular basis
What you'll bring to the team:
3+ years relevant experience in the design and implementation of data and digital solutions (essential), preferably in a consulting role
Experience using computer languages (SQL, SAS, Python, Scala, C#, etc.) to build robust, innovative data and digital solutions.
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and data sets for large-scale commercial environments
Experience in Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud Platform
Familiarity with visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, SAS Viya)
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment to translate business issues into data and digital solutions
A high level of self-motivation, accountability, and drive
Life at KPMG

We offer rewarding careers to talented individuals and a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance. As a KPMG employee, we will offer you:
— An array of health and wellness benefits such as free flu jabs, subsidised sporting events, access to EAP, additional leave to support you if you are diagnosed with COVID-19, access to e-bikes and other facilities. You will also have access to our Wellbeing@KPMG portal which has an extensive array of health and wellness advice.
— Hybrid Working – a mix of working in the office and at home to enhance your work/life balance as well as access to technology to get your 'home hub' set up.
— Work from Overseas policy – extend time connecting with friends and family outside New Zealand
— Flexible leave options, including the ability to purchase additional annual leave.
— Access to ‘Whanau@KPMG’ – 18 weeks’ paid flexible leave for all new parents - primary and secondary carers
— Unlimited access to digital accreditations through our partnership with Microsoft, LinkedIn Learning, with bespoke learning pathways for all employees.
— Corporate discounts on a range of lifestyle goods and services.
— Opportunity to join any of our Inclusion, Diversity and Equity networks as a participant and ally.
— Opportunity to join our Social club and enjoy activities such as cooking classes, painting, quiz nights and more.
— Time off for volunteering.
— Eligibility to our annual discretionary bonus scheme.
— Opportunities for local and international secondments.

We believe that diversity of background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, clients and communities. Our goal is to be recognised as an employer of choice for all, irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability. Further info can be found on our website

— Access to ‘Whanau@KPMG’ – 18 weeks’ paid flexible leave for all new parents - primary and secondary carers
— Unlimited access to digital accreditations through our partnership with Microsoft, LinkedIn Learning, with bespoke learning pathways for all employees.
— Corporate discounts on a range of lifestyle goods and services.
— Opportunity to join any of our Inclusion, Diversity and Equity networks as a participant and ally.
— Opportunity to join our Social club and enjoy activities such as cooking classes, painting, quiz nights and more.
— Time off for volunteering.
— Eligibility to our annual discretionary bonus scheme.
— Opportunities for local and international secondments.

We believe that diversity of background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, clients and communities. Our goal is to be recognised as an employer of choice for all, irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability. Further info can be found on our website

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant. KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.
KPMG is growing its team of talented technical data and analytics consultants. If you are an experienced Data Engineer, Data Scientist or Business Intelligence Analyst and you believe that you are truly a leader in your field, we’d love to talk to you about joining our outstanding cross-functional team.
The varied and fast-moving nature of the solutions we deliver to our clients will allow you to contribute your expertise, learn from working with other exceptional data specialists and have a direct impact on lifting the data maturity and capability of our clients.
The opportunity:
We are looking for driven and experienced Data & Analytics Consultants to join the Digital Lighthouse team at KPMG in Wellington.
KPMG Digital Lighthouse’s data and analytics talent develops data-driven solutions that solve our clients’ toughest challenges. Lighthouse works with complex client problems and leverages deep domain expertise in data engineering, data science, advanced visualisation, and artificial intelligence to provide unique solutions.
In this role, you will support the wider Digital Lighthouse team on a range of initiatives. You will bring your deep technical expertise to the design and delivery of client engagements.
You will contribute to every step of the project lifecycle from developing and winning proposals to managing project delivery and commercials.
You’ll get to work with our highly experienced Management and Risk Consultants who will help make your solutions land with maximum impact and will help you develop new functional skills.
This is a senior role where you will be a key technical mentor and leader within the team, providing coaching and training to junior team members. You will bring your specialist skills and knowledge, developed over your career, to grow new capabilities in our junior team members
Joining KPMG means joining a talented team of remarkable people who bring innovative thoughts and a natural curiosity to the work they do every day. Everyone has the opportunity to succeed at KPMG; our diverse business requires a broad range of personalities, backgrounds, and perspectives. If you share our passion and have authentic data expertise, there’s a place here for you.
Day to day you will:
Design, build and maintenance of data pipelines, data models, advanced analytical models, and data-driven solutions on cloud-based platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure and AWS
Apply scripting language for ETL (extract, transform, load) processes on structured and non-structured databases
Integrate large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
Coordinate and direct assignments in a manner that meets client timelines, budget and outcome requirements
Identify and proactively respond to new business opportunities to provide added value to clients
Contribute to account management to develop awareness of the client organisation, client’s requirements and the services we can deliver
Ensure effective use and application of core KPMG methodologies for which training will be provided on a regular basis
What you'll bring to the team:
3+ years relevant experience in the design and implementation of data and digital solutions (essential), preferably in a consulting role
Experience using computer languages (SQL, SAS, Python, Scala, C#, etc.) to build robust, innovative data and digital solutions.
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and data sets for large-scale commercial environments
Experience in Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud Platform
Familiarity with visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, SAS Viya)
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment to translate business issues into data and digital solutions
A high level of self-motivation, accountability, and drive
Life at KPMG

We offer rewarding careers to talented individuals and a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance. As a KPMG employee, we will offer you:
— An array of health and wellness benefits such as free flu jabs, subsidised sporting events, access to EAP, additional leave to support you if you are diagnosed with COVID-19, access to e-bikes and other facilities. You will also have access to our Wellbeing@KPMG portal which has an extensive array of health and wellness advice.
— Hybrid Working – a mix of working in the office and at home to enhance your work/life balance as well as access to technology to get your 'home hub' set up.
— Work from Overseas policy – extend time connecting with friends and family outside New Zealand
— Flexible leave options, including the ability to purchase additional annual leave.
— Access to ‘Whanau@KPMG’ – 18 weeks’ paid flexible leave for all new parents - primary and secondary carers
— Unlimited access to digital accreditations through our partnership with Microsoft, LinkedIn Learning, with bespoke learning pathways for all employees.
— Corporate discounts on a range of lifestyle goods and services.
— Opportunity to join any of our Inclusion, Diversity and Equity networks as a participant and ally.
— Opportunity to join our Social club and enjoy activities such as cooking classes, painting, quiz nights and more.
— Time off for volunteering.
— Eligibility to our annual discretionary bonus scheme.
— Opportunities for local and international secondments.

We are on a mission to connect creators and consumers around the world. We believe in the magic of content and the impact it has on peoples life.
At Parrot Analytics, we deliver the world’s leading content demand analytics built on the largest demand database to bring the science to the art of content. Rapidly establishing itself as one of the most innovative companies in Hollywood, our products are helping drive a new era in the entertainment industry as we are empowering our clients to make the most powerful data-driven decisions every day.
We are a data science company that empowers media companies, brands and agencies (think Google, Amazon, Facebook, Disney, HBO, Netflix, Lego, Apple) to understand global audience demand for content. Wielding the world’s largest audience behaviour data sets, we have developed the world’s only global cross-platform, country-specific Content Demand Measurement System.
About the Role
We are looking for a talented post graduate to join our data science team to support complex data analysis projects using standard modelling and data transformation approaches. This is a 6-month paid internship program, full time at our Auckland office.
You should be comfortable working with very large data sets residing in different data stores in disparate formats and be strong with hands-on implementation, and data visualisation.
We are always on the look-out for great data-storyteller, passionate about product development, and knows how to use its knowledge to create value for our partners. You will have strong ownership of your project and will be working along side UI/UX designers, product manager and data engineers.
Please note: this job is being funded by Callaghan Innovation, and as such, you need to meet certain requirements before we can hire you. This opportunity is also subject to us getting the grant.
Key responsibilities will include:
Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis, including research, data collection, data preparation and exploring it for accuracy
Application of statistical modelling and optimisation techniques most suited to solve business problem (using R, Python, SQL, and/or other relevant tools)
Implement (and partly design) solutions for a defined data science related problem under the guidance of other experienced data scientists.
Interpret outputs of statistical models and results to translate input from quantitative analyses into specific and actionable business recommendations and implications
Providing detailed documentation of modelling techniques, methodologies, assumptions made and process steps
Identify areas for further investigation as well as creating innovative methods of analysis

Requirements
Recently completed or in the final year of MSc/PhD in the field of Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or related, in New Zealand.
Expertise in one or more of the following domains is preferred: Natural Language Understanding (NLU), Natural Language Generation (NLG), Natural Language Processing (NLP).
Ability to write programs in data science friendly language (R/Python) to prototype and test analytical ideas
Data visualisation skills/experience (Tableau, PowerBI)
Strong probability theory and statistics knowledge and some of the main data science algorithms
Good problem-solving skills
Good understanding of fundamental Machine Learning algorithms and tool-sets
Empathy for customers, teammates, and other stakeholders
Effective communication skills who is able to listen intently and understand the needs of the business and can convert these into clear and easily understood specifications and are able to present this across the teams.
Benefits
At Parrot, you will be in a role you love and work with people you will enjoy sharing life with. We are a diverse team from every corner of the world putting our best foot forward to live our values and master our strengths.
You will get the encouragement, support, flexibility and resources you need to succeed, learn and grow in the role and in your career.
Here are some of our benefits:
Flexible working - location and hours (remote first with office options)
Opportunity to take part in the Employee Share Options Plan
US$1K to spend on training/development every year
Enhanced paid parental leave - 12 weeks for primary carer and 4 weeks for secondary carer
Birthday leave
Bi-annual salary reviews.
To explore other opportunities we have on offer and learn more about us, visit: https://parrot-analytics.workable.com/ We are on a mission to connect creators and consumers around the world. We believe in the magic of content and the impact it has on peoples life.

Why choose us?

Culture
The culture at Annalect NZ is simply one of a kind. We have a culture that we're very proud of over here in Mt Eden, with plenty of initiatives and events throughout the year which constantly creates a buzz around the office as well as strong bonds between employees.

Flexible Working
Flexible working is built on trust and open communication which we highly encourage here at Annalect. You also have access to Birthday Leave, Summer/Winter Fridays, Gifted Day.

Health & Wellbeing
An annual $200 healthy lifestyle allowance, access to our ongoing ‘Thrive' personal wellbeing program, the opportunity to join a range of Annalect/OMD's sports teams, and even free brekkie & coffee!

Learning & Development
We want to encourage our staff to utilise as many opportunities as possible to learn and grow. We offer all types of training, here we pretty much tailor your training to suit your level of the role including our talked-about mentoring program.

So, if you feel you're up for the challenge, this is the opportunity for you! Please apply with a cover letter and resume via the job ad ASAP!

Annalect/OMD is a proud member of Diversity Works NZ and an equal opportunity employer. We offer great flexibility for employees and have a strong focus on health and wellbeing. Here's a sneak peek into the agency for you to enjoy: https://diversityworksnz.org.nz/case-studies/2020-diversity-awards-nz/emerging-diversity-inclusion-omd-new-zealand

Position Purpose

In this role, you will implement and maintain marketing science products, working with the Data and Analytics Manager to package, develop collateral and case studies to provide as a service.

You will collaborate with the team to implement a measurement framework for clients, and work with the extended Data and Analytics team to help develop improvements in the way we extract, process, and analyse the data to ensure we maximise efficiency and profitability (for example, streamlining, and automating workflows).

Help maintain a test and learn culture, testing strategies or hypotheses from insights that can be actioned in live communication environments. Reviewing these tests constantly to refine the thinking and maximise the results.

Support the development of modular Annalect tools that deliver innovation and create an advantage for our client's brands as well as making high profitability for the division.

Innovation is a team focus: look to develop relevant innovation either through product improvement or new development opportunities to deliver solutions for client questions.

Skills and Experience:

Minimum 5 years of experience in a commercial or academic data science role, with experience working with large data sets and technology platforms.
Experience in media advertising is advantageous
High level of programming skills in R (Python & SQL preferred but not essential).
Strong communication skills in both verbal and written form, with a knack for explaining complex analytics concepts to people from all backgrounds.
Experience building and maintaining dashboards on the shiny app.
Must have excellent computer skills and be highly proficient in the use of Ms Word, Ms Excel, PowerPoint, which will be necessary for the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports and presentations, for clients and internal stakeholders.
A post-graduate qualification in the field of Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Engineering Science, or another related field.
Must be passionate and highly skilled data analytics, being skilled in transforming data from large un-qualified datasets into actionable insights and action for our clients.
Must be detail-oriented, have superior problem-solving skills, have an ability to work on multiple projects and meet tight deadlines, have a positive can-do attitude, and demonstrate calmness and composure in times of uncertainty and stress.
Be comfortable working in a collaborative setting yet be self-motivated.

Position Purpose

In this role, you will implement and maintain marketing science products, working with the Data and Analytics Manager to package, develop collateral and case studies to provide as a service.

You will collaborate with the team to implement a measurement framework for clients, and work with the extended Data and Analytics team to help develop improvements in the way we extract, process, and analyse the data to ensure we maximise efficiency and profitability (for example, streamlining, and automating workflows).

Help maintain a test and learn culture, testing strategies or hypotheses from insights that can be actioned in live communication environments. Reviewing these tests constantly to refine the thinking and maximise the results.

Support the development of modular Annalect tools that deliver innovation and create an advantage for our client's brands as well as making high profitability for the division.

Innovation is a team focus: look to develop relevant innovation either through product improvement or new development opportunities to deliver solutions for client questions.

Skills and Experience:

Minimum 5 years of experience in a commercial or academic data science role, with experience working with large data sets and technology platforms.
Experience in media advertising is advantageous
High level of programming skills in R (Python & SQL preferred but not essential).
Strong communication skills in both verbal and written form, with a knack for explaining complex analytics concepts to people from all backgrounds.
Experience building and maintaining dashboards on the shiny app.
Must have excellent computer skills and be highly proficient in the use of Ms Word, Ms Excel, PowerPoint, which will be necessary for the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports and presentations, for clients and internal stakeholders.
A post-graduate qualification in the field of Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Engineering Science, or another related field.
Must be passionate and highly skilled data analytics, being skilled in transforming data from large un-qualified datasets into actionable insights and action for our clients.
Must be detail-oriented, have superior problem-solving skills, have an ability to work on multiple projects and meet tight deadlines, have a positive can-do attitude, and demonstrate calmness and composure in times of uncertainty and stress.
Be comfortable working in a collaborative setting yet be self-motivated.

 Show more
