#LI-DMC1 Show more

Location: Auckland, New Zealand
Permanent - Full time
Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role
The Ministry for Primary Industries' Plant Health and Environment Laboratory (PHEL) in Auckland has an opportunity for a Senior Molecular scientist with Bioinformatic skills to provide molecular and bioinformatics expertise to the Entomology Team. The Molecular Scientist would support the Entomology team in the development and implementation of infrastructure, molecular processes and tools for fast & efficient identification of native and exotic invertebrates affecting plants and environment and will also support analysis and interpretation of High Thorough-put Sequencing (HTS) data.

In this role some of the key focus areas will be:

Implementing innovative concepts, tools and techniques in molecular Biology related to the invertebrate diagnostic capability development, analysis, integration and processing of high-throughput sequence data
Proactively working with others to maximise the benefits of the technologies
Performing laboratory components of assay developments
Publishing high quality peer reviewed scientific, technical and policy papers
Providing coaching and training in molecular biology & bioinformatics to other MPI staff
Maintaining and enhancing our international standing in the scientific community
Maintaining and enhancing our network of national and international laboratory collaborators
Maintaining, developing and strengthening relationships with key stakeholders in New Zealand and internationally, including industry, Maori, government and non-government agencies to support our goals.
Increasing MPI's knowledge of new science, technologies and innovations though developing and maintaining relationships with key science and technology providers.

The salary range for this role is D: from 92k to – 124k based on skill, capabilities, and experience.

Mōu - About You
We are seeking highly motivated individuals with appropriate tertiary education (PhD or post-graduate degree with relevant technical experience). You will have experience in developing molecular assays, developing laboratory workflow for process improvement and in bioinformatics preparing pipelines and programming and data analysis. Our ideal candidate will be a team player with excellent communication skills, leadership ability, initiative, and sound judgment with an ability to think outside of the square.
Preference will be given to applicants with broad molecular biology skills with Bioinformatics, who have worked within a quality environment, have proven planning and organisational skills, project management skills and is able to prioritise under pressure and adapt to changing demands.

Mō tō mātou rōpū - About the Team
PHEL is the national reference centre for the identification of all suspected exotic, new and emerging pests and diseases of plants, and arthropod pests affecting the environment and provides diagnostic services to primary industries to facilitate trade. The laboratory is accredited to ISO 17025.
Our team is dedicated, diverse and highly supportive that operates in a busy and varied environment to deliver our core work programme supporting New Zealand's biosecurity system and our stakeholders. This role will offer you the variety and the challenge to develop and enhance your scientific leadership skills through providing direction, mentoring and supervision whilst driving innovation that will shape our future way of working.

Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to Apply
To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click “APPLY NOW”. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.
If you have any questions about the role, please contact Sherly George, Team Manager, Entomology for a confidential discussion at: sherly.george@mpi.govt.nz
Applications for this role will not be accepted after 5 pm on 21 August 2022.

Te Whakapakari Tahi I Tō tātau Taiao – Enhancing our environment together.
Our vision is a healthy environment and a resilient and prosperous community.
We focus on prioritising:
Te kounga o te wai, te haumarutanga me te mārohirohi ā-āhuarangi o te whakamarutanga | Water quality, safety and climate-resilient security.
Kia koi, kia toitū hoki te whakamahinga o te whenua | Climate-smart and sustainable land use.
Kia ora, kia āhei, kia mārohirohi ā-āhuarangi hoki te rerenga rauropi | Healthy, functioning and climate-resilient biodiversity.
Kia toitū, kia mārohirohi ā-āhuarangi hoki ngā ratonga me ngā hanganga ā-whare | Sustainable and climate-resilient services and infrastructure.

At Hawke’s Bay Regional Council our purpose is to work with our community to protect and manage the region’s precious taonga of rivers, lakes, soils, air, coast and biodiversity for health, wellbeing and connectivity. Our organisation is diverse and our work is varied. Our structure comprises of six key business units; Corporate Services, Integrated Catchment Management, Asset Management, Māori Partnerships, Policy & Regulation, and the Executive Advisory Group which also consists of the Civil Defence and Emergency Management.

About the Opportunity:
Are you passionate about Fresh Water Ecology and looking to join a forward thinking, high delivering team?
We have an exciting opportunity for a Scientist to join the Freshwater Quality and Ecology team in a role that is varied and motivating. The role would suit a freshwater ecologist who is keen to apply their skills to deliver the information needed for the Council to make good decisions for our lakes and rivers, with a particular focus on the application of the national policy statement for freshwater management.

About you:
You will have a relevant post-graduate qualification, experience applying science to solve real world problems, along with excellent analytical, oral communication and report writing skills. As part of a small team with high expectations, you will need to be highly engaged, have excellent people skills and an ability to service multiple work streams across Council.
Ideally you will also have:
Specific knowledge regarding the interactions between hydrological and ecological processes and their relationships, including familiarity with methods of relating contaminant concentrations and river flows in order to calculate contaminant loads or flux and nutrient cycling in aquatic environments and the impact on aquatic plants.
Additional knowledge of processes whereby nutrients, sediments and microbes are input to surface water and groundwater, as well as strategies to minimise the impact of these contaminants, will be useful.
Ability to collate and analyse complex data and interpret the results for technical and non-expert audiences in verbal and written form.
Knowledge of the Resource Management Act.
Knowledge and experience with delivery of technical knowledge to inform resource management planning processes, including community and stakeholder engagement, hearings, development of implementation plans and plan effectiveness reviews.

The salary range for this role is between $85,000 to $95,000 and will depend on the qualifications and experience of the successful candidate.
Other benefits of working for our team include limited income protection and life insurance, subsidised eye tests and lenses, flu vaccinations, and other well-being initiatives. HBRC also has a strong commitment to developing and upskilling people within a flexible and supportive working environment. To see a full list of our benefits please visit our website: https://www.hbrc.govt.nz/our-council/careers/working-with-us/
HBRC is responsible for Civil Defence emergencies and as such, all staff may be called upon to support the response.
All applicants must have existing rights to work in New Zealand.
.
If you are interested in the role please send your application to hr@hbrc.govt.nz.
Applications close 5 September however if we find the right candidates we might close the applications earlier.

At Hawke’s Bay Regional Council our purpose is to work with our community to protect and manage the region’s precious taonga of rivers, lakes, soils, air, coast and biodiversity for health, wellbeing and connectivity. Our organisation is diverse and our work is varied. Our structure comprises of six key business units; Corporate Services, Integrated Catchment Management, Asset Management, Māori Partnerships, Policy & Regulation, and the Executive Advisory Group which also consists of the Civil Defence and Emergency Management.

About the Opportunity:
Are you passionate about Fresh Water Ecology and looking to join a forward thinking, high delivering team?
We have an exciting opportunity for a Scientist to join the Freshwater Quality and Ecology team in a role that is varied and motivating. The role would suit a freshwater ecologist who is keen to apply their skills to deliver the information needed for the Council to make good decisions for our lakes and rivers, with a particular focus on the application of the national policy statement for freshwater management.

About you:
You will have a relevant post-graduate qualification, experience applying science to solve real world problems, along with excellent analytical, oral communication and report writing skills. As part of a small team with high expectations, you will need to be highly engaged, have excellent people skills and an ability to service multiple work streams across Council.
Ideally you will also have:
Specific knowledge regarding the interactions between hydrological and ecological processes and their relationships, including familiarity with methods of relating contaminant concentrations and river flows in order to calculate contaminant loads or flux and nutrient cycling in aquatic environments and the impact on aquatic plants.
Additional knowledge of processes whereby nutrients, sediments and microbes are input to surface water and groundwater, as well as strategies to minimise the impact of these contaminants, will be useful.
Ability to collate and analyse complex data and interpret the results for technical and non-expert audiences in verbal and written form.
Knowledge of the Resource Management Act.
Knowledge and experience with delivery of technical knowledge to inform resource management planning processes, including community and stakeholder engagement, hearings, development of implementation plans and plan effectiveness reviews.

The salary range for this role is between $85,000 to $95,000 and will depend on the qualifications and experience of the successful candidate.
Other benefits of working for our team include limited income protection and life insurance, subsidised eye tests and lenses, flu vaccinations, and other well-being initiatives. HBRC also has a strong commitment to developing and upskilling people within a flexible and supportive working environment. To see a full list of our benefits please visit our website: https://www.hbrc.govt.nz/our-council/careers/working-with-us/
HBRC is responsible for Civil Defence emergencies and as such, all staff may be called upon to support the response.
All applicants must have existing rights to work in New Zealand.
.
If you are interested in the role please send your application to hr@hbrc.govt.nz.
Applications close 5 September however if we find the right candidates we might close the applications earlier.

Te kāinga iho pūmanawa - A Place Where Talent Wants to Live

Flexibility on location of work (Wellington CBD or Gracefield, Lower Hutt)
Base salary + KiwiSaver + Laptop + Mobile Phone
Hybrid/WFH - Flexible working and good work-life balance

About the Role

We're looking for a senior Finance guru to join our team based in Wellington as our Senior Systems & Reporting Accountant. It's an exciting time to join our team as we embark on moving to an agile way of working. In this role you will work closely with our Group Financial Controller and Financial Controller Business Performance to ensure our Financial Management Information Systems are maintained so we can provide quality, accurate and meaningful financial data to our key stakeholders. In this role you will work across the organisation and will be relied on to provide trusted advice to our business groups.

You will also have the opportunity to be involved in the digital transformation of the Finance space as we endeavour to streamline our processes and utilise new digital tools and systems to provide a smooth and efficient experience for our internal and external customers.

To excel in this role, you will;

Role model our organisation's behaviours, along with the Te Tiriti O Waitangi principles, that enable a diverse and inclusive workforce to thrive
Previous experience working in an agile environment is advantageous
Be focused on providing excellent customer service
Have strong technical financial acumen and knowledge of machinery of government
Have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail
Be digitally savvy with previous experience maintaining Financial Management Information Systems
Have an appetite for variety, with a growth mindset
Be on the lookout for opportunities for business and/or process improvements
Have a positive attitude and interpersonal skills which will enable you to develop and maintain great working relationships
Have leadership qualities to take ownership of the role and coach and mentor others

About Us

Callaghan Innovation is New Zealand's innovation agency. It is also a Crown Entity. We activate innovation and help businesses grow faster for a better New Zealand. Our staff - including more than 200 of New Zealand's leading scientists and engineers - empower innovators by connecting people, opportunities, and networks, and providing tailored technical solutions, skills and capability development programmes, and grants co-funding.

We also enhance the operation of New Zealand's innovation ecosystem, working closely with MBIE, NZTE, NZVIF, Crown Research Institutes, and other organisations that help increase business investment in R&D and innovation. Our people operate from five urban offices and a regional partner network in a further 12 locations across Aotearoa

To learn more about us. Follow this link: https://www.callaghaninnovation.govt.nz/

If you're up for the challenge, we'll reward you with responsibility, variety, and a chance to be part of an organisation that's on the road to amazing things.

Applications close: Wednesday 24 August 2022

Please note that we will be interviewing candidates as they come through.

Please contact recruitment@callaghaninnovation.govt.nz if you have any questions or refer to the Capability Profile attached.

Callaghan Innovation is committed to protecting the health, safety, and well-being of all our employees. We have a COVID-19 vaccination policy that is under regular review as Government recommendations and requirements transpire.

We value inclusivity and diversity at Callaghan Innovation. We know that candidates from neurodiverse and underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for roles if they meet all of the criteria. We like to make our hiring decisions based on more than just your previous job experience and qualifications, so if you're keen to apply but are not sure you meet all of the requirements or need additional support please let us know. IRI is powered by people
We're a fast paced, tech driven and people focused business. Innovation and entrepreneurism are part of our core DNA. We like to create, and we like to make things happen. Our team is diverse and is made up of Insight and Industry Consulting Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, Solution Architects and Software Engineers.
As an organisation we're leading the charge as the specialist provider of data-driven, insight and consulting solutions for FMCG retailers and manufacturers.
We power over 250 businesses with a number of services and solutions including;
Client consulting services for the retail, grocery, liquor, tobacco and pharmaceutical sectors
Performance data processing and solutions for the FMCG sector
Consumer shopper, loyalty and analytics programs
Software development and cloud-based reporting platforms
So, why IRI?
We're progressive, inclusive and people focused. We seek to create a down to earth culture which balances work and home life and enables our team to be the best that it can be. Our people are important to us and we offer a number of fantastic benefits including;
Flexibility with the hours you work and where you work them
Employee training and continuous development programs
5 weeks annual leave and holiday buy back scheme
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Birthday leave
Summer half days
IRI Me Days
Key responsibilities:
This is a newly created position where you will support with the roll out of our cloud-based data management and visualisation platform, IRI Liquid Data (ILD). You will enable a smooth transition for our clients as they move to our future state technology.
Working closely with our clients and client facing teams (Client Insights), you will:
Provide support pre, during and post ILD implementation
Map out the change process, including identifying key change stakeholders within the client organisation
Create best practice processes, documenting and sharing with the Client Insights team
Understand challenges and knowledge gaps, and provide a roadmap detailing the support to be provided during the implementation process
Develop and implement strategies to achieve client satisfaction, setting metrics that allow us to measure the level of satisfaction
Working closely with the Australian Client Success Senior Consultant, within a virtual team, to ensure our joint plans are executed in the most effective way
We're looking for:
A tertiary qualification in business, marketing or similar
Previous experience working with scan or shopper data within the FMCG industry (e.g. in an analysis, category or insights role)
Experience with creating and documenting processes and building business artefacts
Strong client servicing skills, with the ability to influence change with senior decision makers
High commercial acumen
Ability to work under pressure and prioritise work effectively
Excellent team working skills and ability to network internally
Strong communication (both verbal and written) and presentation skills
Interested?
We would LOVE to hear from you. Please apply online with your CV.
If you meet some but not all of the above requirements, we encourage you to submit your application. IRI is powered by people

Reporting Manager Title : Location Director - Aotearoa
:
Excellent remuneration package + bonus scheme
Fully flexible working environment
ASX 50 Global Energy Leader
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.
Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success.
The Role
We’re looking for a Director to oversee our Northern Operations which covers our New Plymouth, Whangarei and Auckland offices. This is a senior leadership role that will develop our business in the industrial, water, new energy and power sectors. This role has a strong focus on strategy development and implementation, business development, project delivery and the responsibility of your own P&L.
It’s an exciting time to be joining Worley as we strive to minimise our impact on the environment and deliver a more sustainable world.
Responsibilities:
Business Management of our Northern Operations Team
Full P&L for the region (~$50M)
Identify and secure new business inside and outside of our current core markets
About You:
To enjoy and excel in this role it is envisaged that you will possess the following attributes:
A minimum of 15 years’ experience, with at least 5 years in a consultant or contractor
A tertiary qualification in engineering
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to mentor staff
Bid management and project delivery experieince
Benefits:
Competitive remuneration package + bonus
Purchase up to 8 weeks leave
Flexible working
Respect for your vision, strategy and contribution at the NZ Leadership table
Worley recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to promoting fairness, equity and diversity in its workplace hence we encourage applications from people with a variety of experience and backgrounds. In addition, we recognise that everyone’s personal circumstances differ and thus understand the importance of offering flexibility in the working arrangements of our personnel. On this basis we will consider all types of engagements models. We also offer, the ability to purchase up to 8 weeks leave, compressed work weeks, flexible hours, working from home and accrued flex days, to ensure that we attract and retain a diverse and dynamic workforce. SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
About us/Mō mātou
The Vascular Research Unit operates within the Department of Surgical Sciences, the major academic department of the Dunedin School of Medicine, Dunedin campus. Due to the clinical nature of trials undertaken by the Unit, the research team work closely with the SDHB’s surgical Department, providing ongoing support and clinical planning across all aspects of patient care.
Staff in the Research Unit have ongoing working and professional relationships with Health Research South, Study Sponsor’s, and liaise with General Practitioner clinics on a regular basis. The vascular Research Department also forms the hub for a number of investigator-led clinical research projects and maintains working relationships with other Departments of the University.
The role/Te mahi
As a Clinical Research Nurse (CRN) you will provide research nursing care and high-level administrative support within the vascular Research Unit at the Department of Surgery.
This role gives the opportunity for an excellent work/life balance, with flexible weekday hours working with a small enthusiastic team across all aspects of Clinical Research Nursing. Ongoing professional development, training and post-graduate study supports are available and encouraged.
The main objectives of the role are:
Co-ordinating and leading commercial studies of investigational medications and therapies, concentrating on patient-led clinical care.Liaising with research investigators and co-ordinating enrolment of suitable patients into clinical research projects.Effectively communicating with members of the Research Unit team and clinical staff in the SDHB Surgical/ Vascular Department.Overseeing patient wellbeing and managing clinical interventions such as Wound Care, IV infusions, recording adverse effects, monitoring medication adherence andEnsuring that the regulations governing clinical and research practice are adhered to, including the protocols and guidelines.
Skills and experience/Kā pūkeka me kā wheako
Registered Nursing qualifications are essential, preferably but not mandatory with experience in vascular/ wound care and/or research nursing. Training will be offered to the right candidate, with orientation and induction period available.You need to have excellent communication skills with ability to relate to a wide range of stakeholders including patients, relatives, colleagues, doctors, scientists, and administrators.Precision and accuracy in data handling and input are a must for this role, as well as demonstrated expert skills in clinical problem solving and assessment.
Further details/Pūroko
This is a full-time (1.0 FTE), fixed term (1-year) position, located in Dunedin.
We offer a competitive salary, five weeks’ annual leave, and a 6.75% superannuation scheme.
The University is committed to meeting its obligations under the Children Act 2014. Candidates who successfully make the final stages of the recruitment process will be required to undergo a safety check.
You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this position.
For further information, or to discuss the role in confidence, please contact Mrs Jolanta Krysa, HOD Surgical Sciences, via the contacts details below.
Application/Tono
To submit your application (including CV and cover letter) please click the apply button. Applications quoting reference 2201150 will close on Sunday, 21 August 2022. The University reserves the right to close this vacancy at any time. Research Nurse, Vascular2201150

Be a part of the team transforming NZ Post through the power of data
We're investing in best in class technologies with experienced and passionate people
Generous work from home options and flexible location around NZ

NZ Post has an enterprise wide ambition to ensure that data underpins and heightens our customer and employee experience.
Mō te Tukurau Aotearoa - About NZ Post
NZ Post has been a vital link for New Zealanders for over 170 years, and in the future, we will continue to be a trusted Kiwi company that helps customers succeed and helps New Zealand grow. We're currently on a journey of change designed to support our transformation strategy to deliver customer driven technology solutions, with greater speed to market and keeping pace with emerging technology.
NZ Post has an enterprise wide ambition to ensure that data underpins and heightens our customer and employee experience. We have a vision of building a universally data smart organisation where the best of machine and the best of humans collaborate to create a smarter, efficient, more profitable organisation. This means that every day we aim to drive easy access to valuable insights at the speed of business.
Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role
The Senior Data Engineer plays a pivotal role in ingesting raw data and operationalising NZ Post's most valuable data and analytics products. Our data engineers work in cross-functional squads with other data professionals to build integrated and reusable data pipelines and transformations that enable faster data access, integrated data reuse and improved time-to-solution.
A key part of the role is being responsible for moving these data pipelines (including transformations) effectively into production and making curated data sets available for key data and analytics consumers e.g. business/data analysts, data scientists.
The Senior Data Engineer is responsible for providing support for data products and solutions that have deployed into production as well as measuring and monitoring the on-going performance of data pipelines, products and the data platforms, ensuring they meet the needs of the organisation.
Mōu - About you
We're looking for an experienced data engineer who has a keen interest in data modelling and would relish the opportunity to help us accelerate the data modelling part of our practice. You'll be someone who enjoys working with a team of capable and experienced peers and who values autonomy.

To be successful in this role you'll need:

Around 5+ years of work experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization.
At least 2 years of experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders to deliver data initiatives or data products.
Hands-on development experience using SQL and Python.
Previous data modelling experience using 3NF, Kimball and Data Vault would be highly advantageous.
Exposure to Snowflake and dbt would be considered advantageous.
Ability to design, build and manage data pipelines for data structures encompassing data transformation, data models, schemas, metadata and workload management.

What's in it for me?
We offer a competitive salary package which includes a 4% KiwiSaver contribution, 22 days annual leave, and medical care for you and your family. Important too is a great work whanau - you'll have strong team of highly capable peers alongside you, and a leader who will empower you at the helm. You are encouraged to be autonomous in how you deliver so you can achieve a work & life balance tailored for you – including where you choose to live in the country.
And, there are career development opportunities across the NZ Post group – we proactively source talent from within.
Interested? Come join the Whanau!
Apply today, or to find out the full requirements of the role please download the JD available via the NZ Post website. If you require additional information, contact Rachel Wilson (Talent Acquisition Specialist) on Rachel.Wilson@nzpost.co.nz
Applications for this position close on Monday 8 August 2022. Please note we will review applications on a rolling basis and may progress applications prior to the closing date.
All external applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a credit check and/or drug test.

There's something really special about being part of the team here at NZ Post - Tukurau Aotearoa, who we are and what we stand for is grounded in our values.
We are proud to be Rainbow Tick certified and recognise the diversity and uniqueness of our workforce and reaffirm our commitment to create a safe and inclusive environment for everyone.

20490BR
Requisition Number:
20490BR
Description:
Flexible locations nationally
Foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.
We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.
About the role
You'll join a team of geotechnical engineers and engineering geologists where you will be supported by our Geotechnical leadership to deliver great project outcomes. You’ll be involved in a range of engineering projects from transportation including bridges and other transportation infrastructure, and water and wastewater infrastructure throughout New Zealand and Asia Pacific.
A typical week could see you planning and undertaking site investigations, carrying out geotechnical assessments, designing retaining walls, foundations, slope stabilisation measures, ground improvements or pile design, delivering detailed technical engineering reports and managing the construction of these structures. You'll provide advice to clients and provide input to successful project solutions.
Day to day tasks would involve:
Determining internal and external client requirements
Conducting and manage field data acquisition, site investigations and testing
Producing calculations, reporting, specifications and drawings to ensure that geotechnical designs provide appropriate solutions
Providing quality check and review experience to an appropriate technical standard
Providing geotechnical expertise to meet project needs
Planning and delivering geotechnical project inputs to the agreed outputs on budget, on time and to agreed quality standards
Title:
Geotechnical Engineer
Qualifications:
To be successful for this role you'll need:
To be a degree qualified Geotechnical engineer with 3+ years’ experience and working towards CPEng, ideally in the engineering consulting and contracting industries. Previous experience in New Zealand, Australia or Asia Pacific would be useful. You'll have a strong background in design, ideally in the bridging, transportation and water sectors and be familiar with industry standard design software.
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job Type: Regular
Job Category: Civil Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering
Preferred Specifications:
What we offer
Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.
Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts, job sharing and part time working
Learning and Talent Development Programs including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
Mentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor others
Professional Memberships
Mental Health & Wellbeing programs
Health Insurance – Income Protection Insurance – Life Insurance
Service Recognition Awards
Employee Assistance Program
How to apply
To discuss in more detail contact Margaret McMeel 09 580 4502 or 027 544 2930 or apply directly online.
About Stantec:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.
The Stantec community unites approximately 25,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!

job_title: Data Engineer - Cloud HPC, Edge, and AI - NIWA
listing_jobDesc:
Are you passionate about utilising HPC and data science to make world leading scientific discoveries? Keen to push the limits of Data and AI innovation at supercomputing scale? Do you thrive on the challenge of working across different and complex disciplines? If so, then this is the position for you.

Based at NIWA in Wellington, Auckland, Hamilton, or Christchurch New Zealand
Permanent, full-time

About NIWA

NIWA is a dynamic research organisation whose purpose is to enhance the economic value and sustainable management of New Zealand's marine and freshwater resources, to provide understanding of climate and atmospheric state and processes, and increase resilience to weather and climate-related hazards to improve safety and wellbeing of New Zealanders.

The position

We invite applications from outstanding Data Engineering candidates that want to contribute to developing and integrate state-of-the-art Cloud, HPC and data science solutions - into NIWA's scientific and commercial research, solutions, and services.

The Data Engineer will undertake direct and complex HPC-based data platform development and data science work. The position will provide advice and support on data engineering and research data management to researchers from a wide range of disciplines at NIWA. Primary responsibilities include

Developing and managing data and AI tools, pipelines, and workflows to interface with NIWA HPC systems (both in-cloud and on-premise and scientific/operational instrumentation (e.g. sensor systems and stations)
Developing on-premise, cloud-based and hybrid research data services, storage solutions, and data migration and management solutions
Contributing to and leading designs, planning, and implementation of the NIWA research data infrastructure (including databases, data lakes, etc.)
Automating the curation, coordination, and management of HPC data collections

The Data Engineer will be expected to represent NIWA as authorities in HPC and research data engineering in national and international fora and communities.

What you will need to have

A postgraduate-level qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, or Data Science, or equivalent experience, with strong skills in implementing machine learning/deep learning solutions
Expertise with data engineering in Cloud environments (AWS or Azure) and the ability to develop highly reliable, robust, and secure solutions.
Experience with large-scale data transfer technologies, data storage, and cloud migration concepts
Experience with Linux and working on data science platforms
Experience applying CI/CD tools and techniques to the management of infrastructure (Ansible, Jenkins, etc.) and DataOps/DevOps methodologies.

You will need to be well organised and have good communication skills, and you should be comfortable operating in a team environment. You will also need tenacity to persevere with difficult tasks and remain results oriented, with good customer focus.

Interested?

NIWA offers competitive remuneration and benefits and an attractive waterfront location in Wellington with free parking. A job description, online applications and further information can be found at https://careers.sciencenewzealand.org/niwa/niwa-jobs.

We don't expect perfection in our candidates - if you think you have what it takes, but don't meet every point referenced in the position description, please still get in touch!

NIWA offers flexible working options (e.g., part-time, flexible start and finish times). We are happy to discuss potential flexible options for this position at the interview stage.

NIWA promotes the importance and value of an inclusive and diverse workforce, including the Rainbow Community, and pride ourselves on being a family-friendly and supportive workplace.

The position

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world._

_We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world._

Ideas have no borders and this ethos is embedded in our culture. Graduates – with their fresh thinking and passion for reimagining what’s possible – are critical to our success. As a graduate, you will have the chance to work alongside like-minded professionals and industry leaders on iconic projects that help shape and connect our cities and communities.

The Role:
The team provides services ranging from project management, feasibility studies, detailed design, contract administration and construction supervision for geotechnical works. They support internal and external clients on a wide variety of projects, but predominantly in road, rail, airports, ports and harbours, flood alleviation, commercial and industrial developments, landslip investigation and remediation.

Work on a range of projects, involving work such as:

Desk studies, site inspections, rockface surveys and geomorphological mapping
Contribute to the planning and procurement of ground investigations
Supervise ground investigation fieldwork
Geological interpretation and preparation of interpretative reports
Analysis of geotechnical data, preparation of ground models, design and reporting on foundations, retaining walls, soil slope stability, earthworks, rock slope stabilisation.

Minimum Requirements


Excellent organisation and communication skills
Self-motivated and eager to learn
Strong team player
Demonstrated time management and organisational skills
A strong sense of commitment and a desire to work in a dynamic deadline-driven environment

Preferred Qualifications


BE(Civil), ME, BSc(hons), MSc or PhD or similar

Our Graduate Program

Our Growing Professional Skills (GPS) graduate program is designed to help you bridge the gap between formal education and the workplace. The program is spread across two years, drawing on a range of personal development activities, exposure to other graduates and business leaders, and a range of topics designed to grow your business and professional skills, so you become Business Ready.

Along with local site visits, technical seminars, and internal and external training, AECOM connects you with local and global teams to source knowledge and experience, which creates an invaluable network that helps you learn, grow, and develop your professional skills.

As an added incentive, your involvement in the GPS program is fully endorsed for those seeking Professional accreditation. If you decide to do additional studies, we will help you examine your options and identify areas of specialisation to support you in your career.

Click here to find out more about our graduate program

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world._

_We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. job_title: Technologist - Co Lead Field Biometrics - Scion
listing_jobDesc:
Technologist - Co Lead Field Biometrics

Based in Rotorua

Fulltime permanent role

Use your ingenuity and skills to make a difference to NZ's renewable energy future
Excellent teamwork and development opportunity

Are you someone eager to join an organisation that prides itself on its science? Whose nation highly values the science we produce? If so, then please read on……

We are looking for a scientist/technologist keen to co-lead our multi-disciplinary Biometrics team who is a champion of science excellence and innovation. A person who is eager to contribute to the research and development of activities creating impactful science that really makes a difference to the New Zealand forestry industry.

Who are we?

Scion is a Crown Research Institute who specialises in research, science and technology development for the forestry industry, wood products, and wood-derived materials. We lead new technology development for renewables, bioproducts and energy and the establishment of a broader based bio-economy.

What does the role entail?

Reporting to Research Group Leader, you will:

Co-lead a team of field technicians to conduct forest mensuration data collection including standard tree measurement, soil and foliage sampling and wood quality assessments
Perform a range of fundamental and applied field and laboratory research techniques delivering valuable trial data.
Work closely with Portfolio and Project Leaders, providing you with opportunities to develop, lead and contribute to research projects.

What are we looking for?

A Scientist/Technician with proven expertise in the management of field trials, undertaking field work or forest assessments, and some laboratory experiments.
A leader who can mentor and coach a dedicated team with a view of building skills and capability.
The ability to work proactively with stakeholders such as DOC and corporate forest owners to build strong relationships and identify opportunities and collaborations.
You are keen to expand your science career by also being involved in exciting research projects
Flexible and results-driven and having a self-motivated attitude will be key to your success, as you will be working with diverse teams across a broad range of disciplines

Prerequisites for this role are a Science qualification, plus 5+ years practical experience in a related Forestry field.

We are home to creative science minds and have a vibrant culture ensuring employees can pursue innovation and excellence in their science delivery. With its head office based on the edge of Rotorua's world famous Whakarewarewa Forest, Scion also offers an enviable working environment with excellent work/life balance initiatives. Rotorua is one of New Zealand's leading tourist destinations owing to its outstanding natural environment and proximity to coastal beaches and inland lakes, native forests, geothermal areas and volcanic ski-fields.

If this sounds like an opportunity you would like to pursue, for further information and to apply online, please refer to our website: www.scionresearch.com

Closing Date: 2 September 2022

Job Details

Crown research institute Scion

Reference # 47539

Posted on 18 Aug 2022

Closes on 02 Sep 2022 17:00

Location(s) Rotorua

Expertise Forest Management

Job level(s) Scientist

Work type(s) Permanent

A person who is eager to contribute to the research and development of activities creating impactful science that really makes a difference to the New Zealand forestry industry.

Who are we?

Scion is a Crown Research Institute who specialises in research, science and technology development for the forestry industry, wood products, and wood-derived materials. We lead new technology development for renewables, bioproducts and energy and the establishment of a broader based bio-economy.

What does the role entail?

Reporting to Research Group Leader, you will:

Co-lead a team of field technicians to conduct forest mensuration data collection including standard tree measurement, soil and foliage sampling and wood quality assessments
Perform a range of fundamental and applied field and laboratory research techniques delivering valuable trial data.
Work closely with Portfolio and Project Leaders, providing you with opportunities to develop, lead and contribute to research projects.

What are we looking for?

A Scientist/Technician with proven expertise in the management of field trials, undertaking field work or forest assessments, and some laboratory experiments.
A leader who can mentor and coach a dedicated team with a view of building skills and capability.
The ability to work proactively with stakeholders such as DOC and corporate forest owners to build strong relationships and identify opportunities and collaborations.
You are keen to expand your science career by also being involved in exciting research projects
Flexible and results-driven and having a self-motivated attitude will be key to your success, as you will be working with diverse teams across a broad range of disciplines

Prerequisites for this role are a Science qualification, plus 5+ years practical experience in a related Forestry field.

We are home to creative science minds and have a vibrant culture ensuring employees can pursue innovation and excellence in their science delivery. With its head office based on the edge of Rotorua's world famous Whakarewarewa Forest, Scion also offers an enviable working environment with excellent work/life balance initiatives. Rotorua is one of New Zealand's leading tourist destinations owing to its outstanding natural environment and proximity to coastal beaches and inland lakes, native forests, geothermal areas and volcanic ski-fields.

If this sounds like an opportunity you would like to pursue, for further information and to apply online, please refer to our website: www.scionresearch.com

Closing Date: 2 September 2022

IRI is powered by people
We're a fast paced, tech driven and people focused business. Innovation and entrepreneurism are part of our core DNA. We like to create, and we like to make things happen. Our team is diverse and is made up of Insight and Industry Consulting Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, Solution Architects and Software Engineers.
As an organisation we're leading the charge as the specialist provider of data-driven, insight and consulting solutions for FMCG retailers and manufacturers.
We power over 250 businesses with a number of services and solutions including;
Client consulting services for the retail, grocery, liquor, tobacco, and pharmaceutical sectors
Performance data processing and solutions for the FMCG sector
Consumer shopper, loyalty, and analytics programs
Software development and cloud-based reporting platforms
So, why IRI?
We're progressive, inclusive and people focused. We seek to create a down to earth culture which balances work and home life and enables our team to be the best that it can be. Our people are important to us and we offer a number of fantastic benefits including;
Flexibility with the hours you work and where you work them
Employee training and continuous development programs
5 weeks annual leave and holiday buy back scheme
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Birthday leave
IRI Me Days
Summer half days
Key responsibilities:
You will be working across a varied portfolio of clients including health and beauty and food. Leading the client relationship from end to end, you will:
Establish and maintain strong and trusted client relationships
Support clients as they transition to our newest technology, IRI Liquid Data
Understand client growth strategies and provide advice and recommendations
Develop, maintain, and execute assigned initiatives from client account plans
Undertake project briefs from clients and use IRI data to meet the brief objectives
Mine data, construct analysis and provide insights
Present insights and findings to the client
Contribute to Client Service team best-practices which will continue to elevate IRIs reputation for excellence in this area
We're looking for:
4+ years' experience in category management for a FMCG retailer or manufacturer, or experience working at an FMCG market research agency
Strong Excel data handling skills
Previous experience analysing scan or shopper data
Strong client servicing skills, with the ability to build and maintain effective relationships
Ability to manage client expectations
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and presentation skills
A naturally curious mindset, with the ability to creatively problem solve
Capability to work prioritise effectively, and work to tight deadlines
Interested?
We would LOVE to hear from you. Please apply online with your CV.
If you meet some but not all of the above requirements, we encourage you to submit your application. IRI is powered by people

Description:
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.
We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.
The infrastructure industry is changing and needs a more digital focus. Help us leverage technology to change the way we do work for our clients.
About the role:
Ideally based in our Wellington office reporting to the Design Technology Development Team Leader and working across the NZ business on both Water & Transportation projects, we are looking for a Power Platforms developer to automate business workflows using Power Platforms.

Power Platforms Developer
Qualifications:
Required Skills:
\tPower Apps
\tPower Automate
\tSharePoint
Desirable Skills:

\tAzure Management
\tDynamics 365
About you
\t2 years’ experience developing applications within Power Apps
\tStrong understanding of data security and integrity
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job Type: Regular
Job Category: Software Development
Preferred Specifications:
What we offer:
Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.
Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts, job sharing and part time working
Learning and Talent Development Programs including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
Mentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor others
Professional Memberships
Health Insurance – Income Protection Insurance – Life Insurance
Service Recognition Awards
Employee Assistance Program
Flexible Working Arrangements
How to apply:
Applications close Monday 22 August 2022
To discuss in more detail contact Glen Tarrant on 04 381 6729 or 027 4430 184 or apply directly online.
No Agency CVs will be accepted.

The Stantec community unites approximately 25,000 employees working in over 400+ locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring water, transport and infrastructure projects to life. Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a nearly 200-year history. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work.

About the Institute of DataThe Institute of Data is a Professional Network of Data Scientists, Cyber Security Analysts and Digital Marketers. In partnership with leading universities UTS and RMIT, the government of Singapore and hundreds of employers, we transform careers for a data-driven world.The Institute of Data operates in the information technology sector. Demand for our training products is driven by the information capability recruitment needs of business. These capabilities, in the areas of security, compliance, operational efficiency, growth and decision making are more important to business now than ever before.Our courses are unlike those offered at traditional education providers. With remote and in-person, you can up-skill from anywhere. Beyond learning knowledge, process and theory, you will experience the real power of practical training by industry experts – allowing you to confidently practice and work in the industry.Job DescriptionWe are looking for Lead Trainers to lead this transformative experience.Remote cohort starting 6th SepTwo evenings 6-9pm and ever second Saturday 1/2dayOur Cyber Security (CS) program is a life-changing educational experience where students graduate with the skills and mind set to take on new careers in a wide variety of Cyber Security roles. Our students are passionate about cyber security, often career changers who are working full time in a similar or unrelated field.Why be a trainer for the Cyber Security course?If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by doing what you know and love, this is the position for you. Reporting Manager Title : Technical Services Director - New Zealand
:
Solving what matters in a changing world.
We’re a global team of engineers, designers, data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world. New Zealand is changing and we are looking for someone with the drive and passion to be forefront of new industry and an innovative leader in your field.
We are looking for an exceptional and motivated individual with excellent technical skills to join our dynamic, professional and friendly team based in New Plymouth.
The Role:
The Delivery Systems Administrator will manage and support development and administration of engineering and design systems.
The Successful Applicant:
We are looking for an experienced Delivery Systems Administrator who has excellent problem solving and multi-tasking skills. You will be proactive and have exceptional people skills and a positive attitude. You will be able to identify critical issues and prioritise requests appropriately.
Required experience and skills:
Over 5 years’ experience in a similar role administering and supporting design systems such as:
Autodesk (Autocad)
PDMS and/or E3D
SmartPlant – SPI, SPE and SPID
Bentley suite and design engineering software including Autoplant and Pro steel
Navisworks
Autopipe
Working knowledge and experience with following systems will be advantageous:
Meridian Enterprise
Application support using MS SQL and C#.Net
Reliotech Fault Tree
ExSILentia 3 & 4 SIL verification software
AVEVA Engineering
This role will offer you an opportunity to become part of a tightknit customer focused team based in one the New Zealand’s great lifestyle locations.
Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Company : Worley

Over 5 years’ experience in a similar role administering and supporting design systems such as:
Autodesk (Autocad)
PDMS and/or E3D
SmartPlant – SPI, SPE and SPID
Bentley suite and design engineering software including Autoplant and Pro steel
Navisworks
Autopipe
Working knowledge and experience with following systems will be advantageous:
Meridian Enterprise
Application support using MS SQL and C#.Net
Reliotech Fault Tree
ExSILentia 3 & 4 SIL verification software

 Reporting Manager Title : Technical Services Director - New Zealand
 :
 Solving what matters in a changing world.
We’re a global team of engineers, designers, data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world. New Zealand is changing and we are looking for someone with the drive and passion to be forefront of new industry and an innovative leader in your field.
We are looking for an exceptional and motivated individual with excellent technical skills to join our dynamic, professional and friendly team based in New Plymouth.
The Role:
The Delivery Systems Administrator will manage and support development and administration of engineering and design systems.
The Successful Applicant:
We are looking for an experienced Delivery Systems Administrator who has excellent problem solving and multi-tasking skills. You will be proactive and have exceptional people skills and a positive attitude. You will be able to identify critical issues and prioritise requests appropriately.
Required experience and skills:
Over 5 years’ experience in a similar role administering and supporting design systems such as:
Autodesk (Autocad)
PDMS and/or E3D
SmartPlant – SPI, SPE and SPID
Bentley suite and design engineering software including Autoplant and Pro steel
Navisworks
Autopipe
Working knowledge and experience with following systems will be advantageous:
Meridian Enterprise
Application support using MS SQL and C#.Net
Reliotech Fault Tree
ExSILentia 3 & 4 SIL verification software
AVEVA Engineering

Be a part of cutting edge science, in a multidisciplinary, innovative research setting
Rotorua based, central location, enjoy an excellent lifestyle balance
Contribute your bioprocess engineering expertise to support Scion's science research
Scion specialises in research, science and technology development for the forestry industry, wood products and wood-derived materials. We lead new technology development for renewables, bioproducts and energy and the establishment of a broader based bio-economy.
You will be part of a team that is an integral part in delivering Scion's bioenergy and biotechnology research which is a key part Scion's Forests to Bio-based Products Impact Area
Reporting to the Chemical & Bioprocess Engineering Team Lead within our Materials, Engineering & Manufacturing group, you will:
Assist with the translation of biotechnology to industrial products
Support early stage industries in NZ
Contribute to current research projects in areas including but not limited to biogas and biohydrogen generation, photosynthesis methane absorption, biofuel production, plastic depolymerization and fermentation
Contribute to funding proposals and scientific papers
Work across our Forests to Bio-based Products Impact Area portfolios
What you'll need to succeed:
Masters degree or PhD in related area of science such as engineering
Expertise in bioprocess design, evaluation, optimisation and safety
Knowledge of general process safety techniques and practice such as HAZOP and/or LOPA
Enthusiastic and innovative approach to science tasks; self-starter with ability to work independently on tasks or as part of a team.
An ability to work well with end-users and stakeholders in the planning and delivery of assigned tasks.
Desirable skills:
Experience and knowledge commercial activities in bioenergy and biotechnology
Experience of mentoring junior staff
Experience and knowledge of NZ science funding system
We are home to creative science minds and have a vibrant culture ensuring employees can pursue innovation and excellence in their science delivery. People enjoy working in this team because our computer scientists, data scientists and geomatics experts are leaders in their field and are skilled professionals with significant experience within the forestry sector. Scion is proud to offer:
A great career that enables positive outcomes for New Zealand, Aotearoa;
Continuous professional development;
Enviable work environment; and
A demonstrated commitment to Good Employer/ EEO principles
Work on the edge of Rotorua's world famous Whakarewarewa Forest.

Te Reo Tātaki (TVNZ) translates to "the leading voice" and our kaupapa (purpose) is to "inspire the conversations of Aotearoa." Each day TVNZ reaches more than two million Kiwis through channels TVNZ 1, 2, DUKE and our digital entertainment platform, TVNZ+. TVNZ's news site 1news.co.nz and our digital news youth brand Re: ensure we connect with people on the issues that matter to them wherever they are.

The opportunity - Te tūranga

We are looking for a curious and collaborative Senior Data Engineer (Advanced Engineering & Analytics), reports to Data & Integration Lead who is passionate about building data solutions and driving change through data to join our Data Engineering team.

This is an exciting new role within our Data Engineering team. As the Senior Data Engineer (Advanced Engineering and Analytics) you will act as the bridge between our data engineering squad and TVNZ's business users, data analysts, data scientists & research analysts.

You will be responsible for:

Partnering with internal stakeholders to build complex engineering solutions that answer strategic business questions with data
Leading the development of advanced data engineering solutions using our Azure Data Platform
Developing and maintaining highly complex feature layer data models & pipelines that allow TVNZ to get maximum value from its data, with high quality, clean, maintainable analytic code.
Building a robust, repeatable MLOpsframework that allows the Data Engineering team to rapidly deliver predictive model input layer datasets to Data Scientists.
Curating, organising and documenting data definitions, metrics and reporting environments across Azure Data Lake, Synapse and PowerBI to unlock value and drive efficiency while ensuring data quality.
Collaborate with data engineers, data analysts & data scientists to develop innovative analytical products.
Work closely with stakeholders to drive automation and identify where we can leverage our data to improve processes & decision making across the company
Supporting the Data Engineers and Data Visualisation teams to build, maintain and provide self-serve data and corporate dashboarding and reporting
Providing technical support to Data Scientists, Research Analysts and Data Analysts

What we're looking for - Tā mātou e kimi nei

Analytics Engineering:

Relevant experience in the data space as an analyst, scientist, engineer or similar role
Demonstratable experience leading multiple advanced engineering projects from concept to operationalisation
Demonstratable hands-on experience with SQL, Python or other statistical programming languages
Familiarity with using Juypter Notebooks or cloud data workbenches is preferrable
Experience tackling Big Data problems using the Hadoop ecosystem
Experience with metadata management and data governance

Data visualisation

Relevant experience building and operationalising end-to-end data analytics visualisations and dashboards, delivering demonstrable value to the business and stakeholders.
Solid and demonstrable experience synthesising complex functional requirements into clean, intuitive visuals that provide insight and support decision making
Experience a broad knowledge of data visualisation approaches including the use of rapid prototyping to create positive and engaging user experience

Data Engineering:

Experience adapting software engineering Best Practice to data analytics
Familiar with the design and build of robust ELT pipelines using ARM templates and automation for resources provisioning (Azure PowerShell)
Good working understanding of Azure services (Synapse Studio, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Cognitive Services, Azure ML, Azure App Service, Azure SQL, Databricks, LogicApps)
Experience with source control collaborative tools such as Git
Familiarity with SCALA an advantage

Working at TVNZ - Te mahi ki Te Reo Tātaki

A vibrant culture where we celebrate our content and our successes, and where we're encouraged to continue learning and growing our careers
A $350 up front allowance to contribute to home office set up expenses.
Comprehensive parental leave - topping up the Government's offering to 6 months at full pay, as well as 6 weeks working at 80% of your normal time at full pay when you return to work, plus 4 week's paid leave and an optional extra 2 week's unpaid for partners.
Lifestyle Leave - the option to buy an extra week or two of leave annually if you want it, to take leave without pay if circumstances allow, or to cash up leave if you've got more than you need.
A $350 annual wellbeing allowance, discounted Southern Cross health insurance, free flu shots, and access to a confidential support, guidance and counselling service.
Superannuation covered - with employee contributions matched up to 5% of salary.

Plus, just announced and coming from July 2022:

Hauora Leave - A bonus 5th week off annually to find your balance and focus on you - whether that's by connecting with whānau, taking time for yourself, or escaping the everyday.
A new Broadband and Mobile benefit offer so you'll be able to work from anywhere and be free to stream and binge watch with no limits.

If you would like to find out more about this amazing opportunity, please feel free to call our Head of Talent Acquisition, Philly Irvine, mobile 021 564 691, she loves to chat about new careers.

Work closely with stakeholders to drive automation and identify where we can leverage our data to improve processes & decision making across the company
Supporting the Data Engineers and Data Visualisation teams to build, maintain and provide self-serve data and corporate dashboarding and reporting
Providing technical support to Data Scientists, Research Analysts and Data Analysts

What we're looking for - Tā mātou e kimi nei

Analytics Engineering:

Relevant experience in the data space as an analyst, scientist, engineer or similar role
Demonstratable experience leading multiple advanced engineering projects from concept to operationalisation
Demonstratable hands-on experience with SQL, Python or other statistical programming languages
Familiarity with using Juypter Notebooks or cloud data workbenches is preferrable
Experience tackling Big Data problems using the Hadoop ecosystem
Experience with metadata management and data governance

Data visualisation

Relevant experience building and operationalising end-to-end data analytics visualisations and dashboards, delivering demonstrable value to the business and stakeholders.
Solid and demonstrable experience synthesising complex functional requirements into clean, intuitive visuals that provide insight and support decision making
Experience a broad knowledge of data visualisation approaches including the use of rapid prototyping to create positive and engaging user experience

Data Engineering:

Experience adapting software engineering Best Practice to data analytics
Familiar with the design and build of robust ELT pipelines using ARM templates and automation for resources provisioning (Azure PowerShell)
Good working understanding of Azure services (Synapse Studio, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Cognitive Services, Azure ML, Azure App Service, Azure SQL, Databricks, LogicApps)
Experience with source control collaborative tools such as Git
Familiarity with SCALA an advantage

Working at TVNZ - Te mahi ki Te Reo Tātaki

A vibrant culture where we celebrate our content and our successes, and where we're encouraged to continue learning and growing our careers
A $350 up front allowance to contribute to home office set up expenses.
Comprehensive parental leave - topping up the Government's offering to 6 months at full pay, as well as 6 weeks working at 80% of your normal time at full pay when you return to work, plus 4 week's paid leave and an optional extra 2 week's unpaid for partners.
Lifestyle Leave - the option to buy an extra week or two of leave annually if you want it, to take leave without pay if circumstances allow, or to cash up leave if you've got more than you need.
A $350 annual wellbeing allowance, discounted Southern Cross health insurance, free flu shots, and access to a confidential support, guidance and counselling service.
Superannuation covered - with employee contributions matched up to 5% of salary.

Plus, just announced and coming from July 2022:

Hauora Leave - A bonus 5th week off annually to find your balance and focus on you - whether that's by connecting with whānau, taking time for yourself, or escaping the everyday.
A new Broadband and Mobile benefit offer so you'll be able to work from anywhere and be free to stream and binge watch with no limits.

If you would like to find out more about this amazing opportunity, please feel free to call our Head of Talent Acquisition, Philly Irvine, mobile 021 564 691, she loves to chat about new careers.

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.
At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.
The savvy use of data underpins every aspect of our product development at Xero. As a Senior Architect in the Data Team you will connect with delivery teams, technical specialists, and business leaders to tackle organisation defining challenges.
Your work will empower Xeros to make decisions based on data, accelerate Xero's ability to deliver ML-inside products, and establish a vision and roadmap for our data discoverability, coherence and governance goals.
About the team:
Architects are part of the Architecture and Integration team that sits within the Technology group of Xero. This role is embedded in the Data team, where you’ll work collaboratively with specialist delivery teams to develop architectural guidance.
The Data team is a collective of specialists driven by a shared mission to help establish Xero as the most insightful and trusted small business platform. We bring together diverse skills as we work on data platforms, data modelling, application development, applied research, ethics, literacy, and strategy, to name a few.
At the heart of our mission is helping Xero and its customers get value from data responsibly, on robust data platforms, with robust methods.
About the role:
You’ll work in close collaboration with diverse colleagues to define, refine, document and champion Xero’s architecture and long-term direction within our Data portfolio.
Covers domains of data warehousing, business intelligence, streaming data, machine learning processing, ethical data use and, critically, self service access to clean, coherent, fresh data to thousands of Xeros across the company
You'll improve the cohesion of Xero’s systems – people, technologies and processes.
Through sound architecture practises, you’ll balance long-term evolvability and scalability with current needs.
You’ll help to integrate the pieces into a beautiful whole, orchestrating our internal systems and third party software solutions to deliver great customer outcomes.
You’ll provide technical governance, ensuring teams have appropriate architectural guardrails for their work.
About you:
You’re an architect with hands-on experience working with data at scale (e.g. at least one of: count based analytics, machine learning based analytics, integration with distributed systems, data ops, data governance and privacy, metadata and schema management).
You embrace a growth mindset, leading change and seeking new and better ways to solve problems.
You thrive on influencing others and negotiating with diverse stakeholder groups.
You enjoy bridging technical and commercial domains.
What you'll bring with you:
Excellent interpersonal communication skills, you’ll be comfortable speaking with engineers, scientists, product stakeholders and business leaders.
Great written and oral communication skills. The ability to frame a discussion, tell a compelling story, and put forward clear recommendations.
The ability to identify, influence and negotiate with disparate stakeholders and the perseverance to lead them to decisions.
Visual communication skills. The ability to diagram physical and logical architectures, sequences and system interactions.
Ability to define and measure non-functional requirements such as reliability, availability, security and performance.
Business analysis, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Ability to evaluate technologies and articulate trade-offs.
Practice of self-reflection and continuous learning.
At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology.
Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.
Xero is continuing to grow and so are the opportunities to join us!
You can choose to perform this role:
In one of our #beautiful offices Auckland, Melbourne or Wellington
Flexibly, through a hybrid of in office and remote working styles
Permanently Remote
As a permanent remote worker at Xero we want to ensure you are getting the same #beautiful employee experience as our in-office Xero’s. Permanent remote Xero’s will benefit from a virtual ergonomic work assessment and funding to assist with the improvement of your at home work setup. Xero will also fund up to 4 trips a year to your most relevant region Xero office. You are part of our #team and we want to see you thrive!
Xero is a Rainbow Tick certified employer.
Xero strongly encourages employees and contractors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work from a Xero office, or engage in any face-to-face Xero business.
