We are looking to recruit a driven Transport Planner into the Transport Advisory team in our Civil Infrastructure Business in Hamilton. This is an exciting opportunity to join a team that has a great relationship and a great pipeline of work with key local and national clients. Reporting to a Principal / Associate Director you will be working within a team in a collaborative and open office environment.

AECOM Hamilton, and our key clients, have an exciting pipeline of work providing opportunities to work on strategic city-shaping projects including a significant amount of public transport, walking and cycling infrastructure planning and design projects.

In this role you will be working on a wide range of transport modelling with a key component of working with interdisciplinary teams and providing high quality and innovative solutions to our clients.

Minimum Requirements

This role is an opportunity to utilise your current knowledge and understanding of transport modelling including some experience using modelling software such as Aimsun and SIDRA. As you will be undertaking data analysis, solid experience using Microsoft Excel will also be part of your current skill set.

+ 2+ years of experience in the field of transport planning or similar

+ Experience in Geographic Information Systems (GIS)

+ Understanding of theory and experience in Transport Modelling

+ Preferred but not mandatory working knowledge of Computer-aided Design (CAD)

Preferred Qualifications

+ Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Geography or Transport planning

+ Master’s Degree while not essential will be beneficial

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. Show more

job_title: Civil and Senior Civil Structural Designer
listing_jobDesc:
Company : Worley
Primary Location
: NZL-TK-New Plymouth
Other Locations
: NZL-AR-Auckland, NZL-WR-Wellington, NZL-CB-Christchurch
Job
: Structural
Schedule
: Full-time
Employment Type : Employee
Job Level : Experienced
Job Posting
: Aug 17, 2022
Unposting Date
: Sep 18, 2022
Reporting Manager Title : Civil Structural Design Coordinator
:
Solving what matters in a changing world.
We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world. New Zealand is changing and we are looking for someone with the drive and passion to be forefront of new industry and an innovative leader in your field.
We are looking for smart , energetic and proficient Civil Structural Designers and Senior Civil Structural Designers who are looking to advance their career with a leading global business. Working with some of the best designers, advisors, engineers, and project and construction professionals in New Zealand, you will be part of our dynamic and growing business.
Worley is a unique business in the engineering services market. We deliver an exceptionally diverse range of services to a wide range of customers. Whether it be traditional consulting engineering, design-build contracting, operations or business advisory we pride ourselves on understanding, solving, and delivering what each customer needs to make their business successful.
These roles present the opportunity to be a key member of our thriving Civil Structural Design team working on multi-discipline industrial projects. To be successful in this role you will have proven ability across a variety of industries which could include food and beverage, water and waste water, petrochemical, energy, and, natural resources. The ideal candidate will have experience in producing 3D models, CAD drawings and other engineering project deliverables while working along with various engineering disciplines, including process, mechanical, instrumentation, controls and electrical.
Core requirements are:
Lead experience with meeting all project deliverables
Proficient with 2D drafting (AutoCAD) and 3D modelling (ProSteel)
Strong attention to detail with a systematic and motivated approach
Flexible approach to your work and clients
Excellent communication skills
Great team player who can also work independently
Worley is a multicultural organisation which offers flexible working hours and a competitive salary. You will form a part of a thriving team and be supported by our head office and wider global business. The selected candidates will be expected to be based in either our Wellington, Tauranga, Napier, Christchurch, Auckland or New Plymouth office – it's flexible.
Our scale is expansive but that is nothing compared to our imagination.
If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Continue to build your future with Worley. Company : Worley

At a glance:
Ref: 42495 | Hamilton (Newstead) | Administration, Data Entry & Documentation, Facilities Management, Personal Assistant, Administration & Support, Receptionist, Contact Centre/Customer Service Representative | Entry, Graduate, Experienced | Fixed term, Full Time | New Ventures Product Support 270522.pdf
About Us

We all have our improvement stories to tell. At LIC we believe in constant improvement, never settling and always striving for greatness. We know little improvements can add up to huge gains for our customers, and for our country. We value NZ primary industries and will do whatever it takes to support and grow our farmer community. We're down to earth and we're a diverse bunch - a mix of super smart scientists, veterinarians, farmers, sales people and clever marketing folk. We are inclusive and count ourselves lucky to have people from all backgrounds working with us.

LIC is based in Newstead, Hamilton, where we enjoy more affordable housing, relaxed commuting, easy parking and a readily accessible outdoor lifestyle. Our campus is in a rural setting just outside Hamilton and includes a social club, swimming pool, onsite parking, tennis and volleyball courts and a café with great coffee. We also offer extra leave days per year, family leave for new parents, discounted insurance, employee shares scheme, mental health & well-being program, internal training programmes and an employee assistance programme to name but a few - and we're still working on improvements!

About the Role

This role is part of the Commercial Group and reports to the New Ventures Operations Manager. Our New Ventures department supports two key products - SPACE Pasture Satellites, and the Wagyu Programme.

We are looking for someone to join us in a fixed term role (parental leave cover) to help us deliver the SPACE Satellite Pasture and Cover Evaluation Service as well as providing administrative support to the Wagyu product.

You will have the flexibility to work in our Newstead office or from home if preferred. Part-time hours can be negotiated for the right applicant. Training and ongoing development will be provided.

Your role will be responsible for:

Providing excellent customer service to our farmers, including inbound and outbound calls and email communications.
Administrative support.
The accurate delivery of SPACE pasture reports to farmers
Support of additional New Ventures products when required.

About You

We are seeking a quality-focused individual with exceptional administration and communication skills. To be successful you will need to demonstrate the following:

Excellent phone manner and confident handling of both inbound and outbound calls;
Exceptional attention to detail and high degree of accuracy in all work;
Experience with MS Office with intermediate skills in Excel
A tertiary qualification in agriculture is not essential but will be a distinct advantage.

How to Apply

If you're after a rewarding and social career with people who embrace our company values of Integrity, Innovation, Spirit of Co-Operation, In-tune and Passion, then we would consider ourselves lucky to welcome you on-board.

For more information and to apply, go to our website https://careers.lic.co.nz/home

Reporting Manager Title : Department Manager - Project Management
:
We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world. New Zealand is changing and we are looking for someone with the drive and passion to be the forefront of new industry and an innovative leader in your field.
We are seeking a smart, energetic and capable Project Engineers to join the team and continue our success. You will have experience delivering projects across one or more of the following sectors; food and beverage, heavy industrial, natural resources, power generation, ports, terminals or hydrocarbons. You will be part of an experienced and supportive team, be involved in variety of industries and may be required to travel.
To be successful you will:
Be an experienced project engineer, ideally with an engineering degree and have a good knowledge of project management processes, tools and techniques
Have 3 – 5 years’ experience in project delivery in the food and beverage, power generation, natural resources, industrial, ports and terminals or hydrocarbon sectors
Have a passion for energy efficiency and new energy and ideally experience in this area
Have strong interpersonal and communication skills and be comfortable in client facing roles
Possess excellent written, oral and presentation skills supported with high computer literacy
You will form a part of a thriving team in our New Plymouth Office and be supported by our head office and global business. We will also consider applicants based in Auckland or Wellington.
Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Company : Worley

Location: Auckland
Salary range: $60,331 to $81,624 depending on skills and experience

As a Te Tiriti o Waitangi partner we are committed to supporting and enabling Māori,
whānau, hapū, Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.

Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role
The Ministry for Primary Industries' Plant Health and Environment Laboratory in Auckland has a vacancy for a full-time Senior Technician in Entomology. You'll provide technical support for professional diagnostic and advisory services for specimens collected during surveillance and investigation activities.

Our Entomology team is dedicated, diverse and highly supportive and operates in a busy and varied environment to deliver our core work programme supporting New Zealand's biosecurity system and our stakeholders. The role requires conducting routine laboratory maintenance, diagnostic processing, routine diagnoses, field investigations, and data management. The position also provides variety and challenge to develop and enhance your technical expertise in entomology while working with a team of scientists.

Mōu - About You
We are seeking a highly motivated individual with a tertiary education or relevant technical experience in entomology. You'll need to have basic recognition and working knowledge of the major groups of plant and environmental pests.
You will have


technical skills in sample processing and diagnostic methods of invertebrates
good written and verbal communication skills
experience in molecular techniques is advantageous

Our ideal candidate is a team player with excellent communication skills, leadership ability, initiative, and sound judgment with an ability to think outside of the square.
Preference will be given to applicants with some identification experience (particularly morphological), who have worked within a quality environment, have proven planning and organisational skills, are able to prioritise under pressure and adapt to changing demands.

Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI
Our role includes seizing export opportunities for our food and fibre sector, improving sector productivity, ensuring the food we produce is safe, increasing sustainable resource use, and protecting New Zealand from biological risk.

Mō tō mātou rōpū - About the Team
The Plant Health & Environment Laboratory (PHEL) is part of MPI's Diagnostic and Surveillance Services (DSS) of the Operations Branch. PHEL is the national reference centre for the identification of all suspected exotic, new and emerging pests and diseases of plants, and arthropod pests affecting the environment. PHEL also provide diagnostic services to primary industries to facilitate trade. The laboratory is accredited to ISO 17025.
We have specialised facilities including a Level 3B quarantine glasshouse and Level 3 tissue culture facility, containment laboratories, equipment for molecular and serological procedures, a transmission electron microscope, light microscopes (enabled for remote diagnostics), and reference collections of pests.

Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI


Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days
Wellness benefit for employees
Reduced premiums for Group Healthcare Schemes

Wā Mahi Ngāwari - Flexible Working
We support work life balance and flexible work arrangements. If you're interested, we are open to discussing flexible working options with you.

Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to ApplyTo view the position description and/or apply online, please click “APPLY FOR THIS JOB” or visit the MPI Careers Site.
To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it – click here to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.

Applications close on 11th September 2022
If you have any questions about the role, please email tegan.parry-thompson@mpi.govt.nz

The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process. Role type: Permanent, Full-Time

Fabulous Location and Workplace
Brilliant Team environment
Career development and opportunity

Superb team, leadership and opportunities for growth – love your work and see the difference it makes in your community.

About the company

This opportunity is based in Stratford and if you have never been, you have no idea what you are missing.

Beautiful location, be up a mountain and on the beach all in the same day, have reasonable house pricing, great schools and access to everything you need; and YES have the environmental job of your dreams being the very best in Water Quality science.

About the role

This is an exciting opportunity for you to use your existing skills and build on these with a fabulous, experienced team where shared personal and professional growth is valued and celebrated.

You will be a contributing to specialist advice, expertise, knowledge, and technical leadership in the area of Water Quality Management for the region.

You will develop, coordinate and deliver environmental programmes and investigations to safeguard the community and beyond.

You will be equally happy in the field taking samples as well as working on policy and governance issues. Whilst field staff undertake collections, you will still be required to develop relationships with stakeholders and be able to positively communicate the outcomes of your work out in the field.

You will be a self-starter, enjoy a great performing team and understand how and when to support others. You will be fully capable across the range of water quality reporting and monitoring and LOVE your work.

Duties

Oversee the monitoring and evaluation of water quality on freshwater receiving environments
Advise of the design, implementation, and reporting of state of environment and compliance monitoring
Provide robust scientific advice and support to a professional standard
Lead, implement and drive the completion of key people activities
Provide support to the Team leader and your wider team as required
Manage and oversee a range of projects at different stages of lifecycle
Remember the days where your work made a difference?? Come do this here…

Skills and experience

Able to demonstrate capability in water quality monitoring and reporting
Able to critically examine environmental data related to land use, water quality, ecosystem health and recreational suitability.
Strong personal drive to make a difference
Superb oral and written skills (including listening)
A real problem solver
Stakeholder and service oriented

I can tell you so much more but please give me a ring instead on 09 424 8367

Culture

Love what you do, deliver, job satisfaction, service first, effective communication and teamwork are what makes this a great place to be.

Benefits

Car parking
Great team
Great career development
Great manager
Great company

What do I need?

3 years; experience in a similar role (scientific monitoring, data analysis and technical reporting)
Tertiary qualification in environmental or physical sciences with a speciality in freshwater science, chemistry, ecology/ biology or related field
Ability to grow is really important

How to apply

If you meet the above criteria, we welcome your application including your CV and cover letter in Word format. If you have any questions, please call Alison Gill on 09 424 8367 quoting reference #1011.

There are no visa/sponsorship opportunities available with this role. This is a permanent position, therefore only applicants with full, valid, permanent working rights will be considered.

Applications are welcomed from NZ Citizens or those with a Residency or current Work Visa in place.

Not quite what you are looking for?
Please register for ongoing opportunities at www.edenfx.co.nz Fabulous Location and Workplace

Genetics Stakeholder Lead

Do you thrive in providing great communications and stakeholder engagement?
Interested in cattle breeding, animal science and farms?
Join an exciting, inclusive workplace that will value and invest in you!

DairyNZ works for New Zealand dairy farmers. Our purpose is to help create a better future for them. This role is part of our NZAEL (New Zealand Animal Evaluation Limited) team whose purpose is to contribute to genetic improvement of NZ dairy cattle.

The Role
Everything we do at DairyNZ is aimed at creating a better future for our farmers. The Genetics Stakeholder Lead contributes by engaging with key stakeholders, farmers and rural professionals to provide a vital link between our genetics/breeding science and practical support for our dairy farmers.

Working within the NZAEL team, and with our internal and external partners, the role also provides technical input, reporting, project management and contributes to thought leadership on how NZAEL delivers DairyNZ strategy.

The NZAEL team is part of DairyNZ’s wider science teams and connected across the organisation. Working alongside science, data, marketing, digital, project and farming talent, and engaging with world class experts, this role provides a fantastic opportunity to make a difference and develop an awesome career within an organisation that values the whole you.

About you:

You will truly enjoy building relationships and connecting with our stakeholders, whether it be farmer groups or breeding companies or scientists. Whilst good genetics know-how is useful, we can teach this. So long as you have a strong interest in learning, growing and being part of a dedicated team. A background of farming, cattle breeding or dairy industry would provide a good starting point, but is not necessary.

Our staff care deeply about their work and how it makes a difference to our dairy farmers, therefore it’s essential that you have a passion for your work and an attitude that aligns with our values of courage, respect, credibility and curiosity.

For a full list of the job detail and requirements, check out the Genetics Stakeholder Lead

job_title: Product Marketing Specialist- Medical Lab Experience Valued!
listing_jobDesc:
Amazing opportunity for a Lab Scientist with aptitude to expand into Marketing.
Work with one of NZ's best Tech Specialists in this Sector.
Great company culture & potential for long term career progression!


About the company

Our client is part of a global health-tech company that supplies innovative digital health solutions to more than 190 countries. With more than 73 offices and 10,000 staff around the world you will be part of a worldwide effort to continually advance healthcare diagnostics and IT systems. In NZ they are known for their range of clinical and lab information systems as well as In-Vitro Diagnostic (IVD) Devices.


About the role


This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with Lab experience who wants to develop a career in Health IT where you will interface with the sales, development & project management teams assisting in driving business opportunities through initiatives including partnering with teams to execute KPI’s, creating video content, planning workshops & marketing to the current/potential client base.


Key Responsibilities

Develop annual product marketing plans
Develop communication plans for brand presence and product marketing
Maintain and improve digital marketing presence
Provide Pre-Sales support through product demonstrations/presentations
Develop product marketing collateral and press releases
Facilitate user groups and product workshops to educate customers, gain feedback and to generate insights for potential product development.


What you’ll bring to the role

A tertiary qualification in Medical Sciences and/or Health Informatics, with business/marketing experience.
Experience within the Healthcare industry and an understanding of Digital Health.
An appreciation of how software can add value to lab data.
Great written and oral skills & an aptitude for learning.
Strong relationship, customer service and communication skills


Benefits

A competitive salary plus additional benefits, including medical, life and income protection insurances
Company mobile phone & laptop etc
Flexible hours and the ability to work from home three days a week
Super Newmarket location - a central hub for public transport
A personalised training programme to advance your skills and knowledge
Be mentored by a proven senior leader


How to apply


Click APPLY or contact Apiksha on apiksha@scitex.co.nz referring to 19/2206/AK for a confidential discussion.


To apply for this vacancy you MUST be a New Zealand citizen, resident, or have already secured the right to work in New Zealand and therefore hold a valid visa.


Scitex specialises in permanent, contract and temporary recruitment - and has done since 1987. We are here to engineer better Mondays. We love connecting talented people with great work opportunities in workplaces where you can thrive and make a meaningful difference. DATANOMIQ ist der erste deutsche Anbieter für Beratung und Dienstleistungen, der Data Analytics ganzheitlich versteht und anbietet. Von klassischer Business Intelligence über Process Mining bis hin zu Data Science und Deep Learning bestreiten wir die Daten(r)evolution aus allen Perspektiven. Wir sind eine innovative und ambitionierte Company mit datenbegeisterten Kollegen. Was uns täglich antreibt ist es, herausragende Lösungen für anspruchsvolle, datenbasierte Probleme zu entwickeln. Bei DATANOMIQ erleben wir das Morgen schon heute. Vielleicht bald mit Dir.
Aufgrund unseres angestrebten Wachstums sowie der kontinuierlichen Erweiterung unseres Lösungs- und Service-Portfolios suchen wir nach motivierten und engagierten Talenten für unsere junge, erfolgreiche Mannschaft. Werde Teil eines sympathischen und zum permanenten Lernen bereiten Teams durch deinen Einstieg als unseren Team Lead für Data Engineers, Data Analysts und/oder Data Scientists.
Deine Aufgaben
Fachliche Beratung und hands-on Projektaufgaben in Kundenprojekten.
Erstellung von Daten-Strategien und Roadmaps.
Erkennung von neuen Kunden- und Projektpotenzialen.
Führung von Mitarbeitern des DATANOMIQ Teams.
Koordination von Projekten auch gemeinsam mit Mitarbeitern der Kunden.
Gewinnung neuer Mitarbeiter und Einsatzfelder sowie pro-aktive Teambildung.
Fachliche Dokumentation von Projekten.
Dein Profil
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in den Fächern Mathematik, (Wirtschafts-)-Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik o. Ä.
Erfahrung in der Beratung mindestens auf Senior-Level
Praktische Kenntnisse in Data Engineering / Analytics / Science
Erfahrung mit agilen Projektmethoden und Tools (z. B. Jira, Asana)
Ausgeprägte Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse
Hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und Zielorientierung
Wenn Du gerne in einem dynamischen Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen arbeiten möchtest, sende uns bitte Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit dem Stichwort „Team Lead“ unter Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie möglichen Eintrittstermins an jobs@datanomiq.de.
Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!
Und deshalb wird es dir bei uns gefallen
Unser Büro befindet sich in bester Lage Berlins mit guter Verkehrsanbindung.
Wir entwickeln deine fachlichen und persönlichen Skills weiter.
Bei uns arbeitest du an spannenden Projekten in unterschiedlichsten Branchen und Größenordnungen – vom Start up bis zum Global Player.
Wir geben die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und DATANOMIQ mitzugestalten.
Flache Hierarchien & eine offene Unternehmenskultur
Arbeiten mit den neuesten Technologien.
Angenehmes und motivierendes Arbeitsumfeld in einem sympathischen Team.
Dein Gehalt steigt mit deiner Leistung, und das sehr zügig! DATANOMIQ ist der erste deutsche Anbieter für Beratung und Dienstleistungen, der Data Analytics ganzheitlich versteht und anbietet. Von klassischer Business Intelligence über Process Mining bis hin zu Data Science und Deep Learning bestreiten wir die Daten(r)evolution aus allen Perspektiven. Wir sind eine innovative und ambitionierte Company mit datenbegeisterten Kollegen. Was uns täglich antreibt ist es, herausragende Lösungen für anspruchsvolle, datenbasierte Probleme zu entwickeln. Bei DATANOMIQ erleben wir das Morgen schon heute. Vielleicht bald mit Dir.
Aufgrund unseres angestrebten Wachstums sowie der kontinuierlichen Erweiterung unseres Lösungs- und Service-Portfolios suchen wir nach motivierten und engagierten Talenten für unsere junge, erfolgreiche Mannschaft. Werde Teil eines sympathischen und zum permanenten Lernen bereiten Teams durch deinen Einstieg als unseren Team Lead für Data Engineers, Data Analysts und/oder Data Scientists.
Deine Aufgaben
Fachliche Beratung und hands-on Projektaufgaben in Kundenprojekten.
Erstellung von Daten-Strategien und Roadmaps.
Erkennung von neuen Kunden- und Projektpotenzialen.
Führung von Mitarbeitern des DATANOMIQ Teams.
Koordination von Projekten auch gemeinsam mit Mitarbeitern der Kunden.
Gewinnung neuer Mitarbeiter und Einsatzfelder sowie pro-aktive Teambildung.
Fachliche Dokumentation von Projekten.
Dein Profil
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in den Fächern Mathematik, (Wirtschafts-)-Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik o. Ä.
Erfahrung in der Beratung mindestens auf Senior-Level
Praktische Kenntnisse in Data Engineering / Analytics / Science
Erfahrung mit agilen Projektmethoden und Tools (z. B. Jira, Asana)
Ausgeprägte Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse
Hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und Zielorientierung
Wenn Du gerne in einem dynamischen Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen arbeiten möchtest, sende uns bitte Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit dem Stichwort „Team Lead“ unter Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie möglichen Eintrittstermins an jobs@datanomiq.de.
Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!
Und deshalb wird es dir bei uns gefallen

Leaven is the Cloud Transformation Business Unit of CCL, and part of the Spark Business Group.

Our purpose is to enable Aotearoa to thrive and adapt in a digital world, and we do this by enabling and driving public cloud adoption, digital innovation, and business transformation.

About the Role

The Senior Developer role is attached to the innovation practice to further their skills and move towards a roll within the team of data scientist. They will work closely with existing team members, interns, and other parties to deliver a wide range of innovation projects focusing on business optimisation through innovation for external and internal clients. These will include but are not limited to computer vision projects, natural language processing projects, data analytics projects, data visualisation, and mechatronics.

In every interaction you will demonstrate:

Growth Mind Set - you are adaptable and open to change and learning, as well as sharing knowledge and experience.
Collaborative Ownership - you take ownership of your own actions and collaborate well with others across a diverse group of people.
Passionate about Client Success - you do what you say you will do, when you said you would do it and you challenge for better outcomes.

About Us

Leaven is the Cloud Transformation Business Unit of CCL, and part of the Spark Business Group.

Our purpose is to enable Aotearoa to thrive and adapt in a digital world, and we do this by enabling and driving public cloud adoption, digital innovation, and business transformation.

Founded in 2019, Leaven operates to provide agnostic and independent transformation advisory and delivery expertise to clients across all industries and regions of Aotearoa.

We combine local knowledge and experience with robust and proven delivery methodologies to help organisations embrace, run, and innovate on the public cloud and transform ways of operating and working - with a goal of delivering early, frequent, and tangible business results.

What We Give You

In return, Leaven will provide an empowering environment that nurtures the right candidate and promotes innovation and growth, a competitive package is on offer.

At Leaven we are proud of our culture. We're kiwi owned and operated. We are whānau. We have each other's backs and have created a relaxed way of working together while also meeting high delivery expectations.
Reference # 7953

Closes on 01 Oct 2022

Auckland location
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind .
We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.
About the role
You'll join a team of geotechnical engineers and engineering geologists where you will have the opportunity to contribute to the geotechnical/engineering geologist leadership group and global community to help shape the development of the team. You’ll be involved in a range of engineering projects including dams and hydropower, transportation, and water and wastewater Infrastructure throughout New Zealand and Asia Pacific.
A typical week could see you planning and undertaking site investigations and testing, designing ground improvements foundation or pile design, undertaking risk assessments and delivering detailed technical engineering reports. You'll provide high-end advice to clients and lead and develop innovative and successful project solutions. Mentoring, training and developing other members in the team will also be a key part of the role.
To be successful in this role you will need to:
Determine internal and external client requirements
Conduct and manage field data acquisition, site investigations and testing
Produce calculations, reporting, specifications and drawings to ensure that geotechnical designs provide appropriate solutions
Provide quality check and review experience to an appropriate technical standard
Provide geotechnical expertise to meet project needs
Plan, program and coordinate geotechnical projects, as a technical leader, to deliver the agreed outputs on budget, on time and to agreed quality standards
Develop and mentor junior staff.
Title:
Senior/Principal/Tech Director Geotechnical Engineer
Qualifications:
We're looking for Engineering NZ CPEng accredited geotechnical engineers with senior level geotechnical experience, ideally in the engineering consulting and contracting industries. Previous experience in Singapore, Australia or Asia Pacific would be useful. You'll have a strong background in design, ideally in the dams and hydropower, transportation or water sectors and be familiar with industry standard design software. You'll also need a strong track record of managing client relationships and winning work.
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job Type: Regular
Job Category: Civil Engineering
Preferred Specifications:
What we offer
Along with a competitive salary, we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development and wellbeing are ongoing.
Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts, job share and part time hours
Learning and Talent Development Programs including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
Mentoring for your own development
Professional memberships
Health Insurance – Income Continuance Insurance (ICI) – Life Insurance
Service Recognition Awards
Employee Assistance Program
How to apply
To discuss this opportunity further, please contact Margaret McMeel on +64 9 580 4502 or mobile +64 275 442 930 or apply directly on line.
About Stantec:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.
The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

Your Impact:
Our bodies and environment all depend on water, it is the building block that supports all life. Water issues are becoming increasingly prominent as we struggle with disparity between water availability and demands, water pollution, and competition for limited water resources. At Jacobs, our scientists, engineers, and planners are working together with clients to find the right solutions to their water challenges.
A career at Jacobs provides you with the opportunity to make a positive impact and deliver solutions that bring value to our communities, and society as a whole. With a workforce of 55,000 operating across much of the globe, we use our Solutions and Technology framework to provide technical development to our staff, which then enables us to develop innovative ideas to solve our client’s challenges. Our water business provides the full spectrum of consulting services from advisory and engineering through to operations and asset management.
On top of the exposure to challenging projects and career development opportunities, we offer competitive remuneration packages and multiple staff benefits such as paid parental and partner leave, purchase leave, and mental health & wellbeing programs, to name a few. We also support a plethora of flexible working practices such as flexible start/end times, job share arrangements, working from home, and part-time arrangements.
About the role
We are looking for a Senior Hydrologist and Flood modeller to help us deliver a strong pipeline of work on high profile and challenging projects for Water and Infrastructure (ie. road, rail, power) clients across Australia and New Zealand. Our team contribute to the whole value chain of water resource management, including data collection, environmental approvals, compliance monitoring/reporting, infrastructure design and advisory to Government in the development of policy.
The purpose of this role is to lead hydrology and flood modelling investigations and to collaboratively work with other disciplines on both small and large as well as simple and complex projects. You will have experience in developing models, analysing and interpreting data, and presenting it a way that effectively communicates your evidence and recommendations so that our clients can make decisions. You will have sufficient knowledge of legislation and policies relevant to hydrology and flood modelling, and be equipped to work collaboratively with other disciplines to ensure successful delivery of multidisciplinary infrastructure projects. It is expected that you will have project management experience, and will be able to write proposals for, win and manage smaller projects within the area of your technical expertise, and contribute to more complex projects.
You will work with a team of passionate scientists and engineers who truly value diversity and technical excellence and come from backgrounds in the private and public sectors, as well as academia. We will support you with your career ambitions through mentoring, formal and informal training, and attendance at conferences. We have an ANZ-wide annual promotions process, which provides a transparent framework for career progression, and enables direct conversations about performance and the value you are adding to our clients and wider team.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
You will be responsible for:
Undertaking and leading a range of hydrology and flood modelling projects.
Preparation of risk assessments and method statements, data collation and analysis.
Providing specialist support to other technical disciplines within Jacobs, including for infrastructure projects.
Liaison with clients, stakeholders and regulators, and with the wider Jacobs teams across the globe.
Presenting information to clients and stakeholders at meetings in a concise and effective manner.
Authoring complex assessments / reports.
Managing projects so that they are delivered on time, within budget, and to the agreed quality.
Developing internal and external client contacts.
Jacobs. A world where you can.
From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. By supporting one another, we all succeed.
With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.
At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.
Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.
#LI-DMC1 Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

Your Impact:
Our bodies and environment all depend on water, it is the building block that supports all life. Water issues are becoming increasingly prominent as we struggle with disparity between water availability and demands, water pollution, and competition for limited water resources. At Jacobs, our scientists, engineers, and planners are working together with clients to find the right solutions to their water challenges.
A career at Jacobs provides you with the opportunity to make a positive impact and deliver solutions that bring value to our communities, and society as a whole. With a workforce of 55,000 operating across much of the globe, we use our Solutions and Technology framework to provide technical development to our staff, which then enables us to develop innovative ideas to solve our client’s challenges. Our water business provides the full spectrum of consulting services from advisory and engineering through to operations and asset management.
On top of the exposure to challenging projects and career development opportunities, we offer competitive remuneration packages and multiple staff benefits such as paid parental and partner leave, purchase leave, and mental health & wellbeing programs, to name a few. We also support a plethora of flexible working practices such as flexible start/end times, job share arrangements, working from home, and part-time arrangements.
About the role
We are looking for a Senior Hydrologist and Flood modeller to help us deliver a strong pipeline of work on high profile and challenging projects for Water and Infrastructure (ie. road, rail, power) clients across Australia and New Zealand. Our team contribute to the whole value chain of water resource management, including data collection, environmental approvals, compliance monitoring/reporting, infrastructure design and advisory to Government in the development of policy.
The purpose of this role is to lead hydrology and flood modelling investigations and to collaboratively work with other disciplines on both small and large as well as simple and complex projects. You will have experience in developing models, analysing and interpreting data, and presenting it a way that effectively communicates your evidence and recommendations so that our clients can make decisions. You will have sufficient knowledge of legislation and policies relevant to hydrology and flood modelling, and be equipped to work collaboratively with other disciplines to ensure successful delivery of multidisciplinary infrastructure projects. It is expected that you will have project management experience, and will be able to write proposals for, win and manage smaller projects within the area of your technical expertise, and contribute to more complex projects.
You will work with a team of passionate scientists and engineers who truly value diversity and technical excellence and come from backgrounds in the private and public sectors, as well as academia. We will support you with your career ambitions through mentoring, formal and informal training, and attendance at conferences. We have an ANZ-wide annual promotions process, which provides a transparent framework for career progression, and enables direct conversations about performance and the value you are adding to our clients and wider team.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
You will be responsible for:
Undertaking and leading a range of hydrology and flood modelling projects.
Preparation of risk assessments and method statements, data collation and analysis.
Providing specialist support to other technical disciplines within Jacobs, including for infrastructure projects.
Liaison with clients, stakeholders and regulators, and with the wider Jacobs teams across the globe.
Presenting information to clients and stakeholders at meetings in a concise and effective manner.
Authoring complex assessments / reports.
Managing projects so that they are delivered on time, within budget, and to the agreed quality.
Developing internal and external client contacts.

Research Project Lead (Water) | Kaihautū Wai Māori o Ngāti Awa – Te Rūnanga o Ngāti Awa

Whakatāne location
Two Year Fixed Term Contract
Electric Vehicle for use of contract term

Freshwater is essential to life, vital to survival, he taonga te wai!

Working with Te Rūnanga o Ngāti Awa, come play a pivotal role in Te Mahere Rautaki Wai Māori o Ngati Awa Project for enhancing the mauri o te wai within the Ngati Awa rohe.

Managing your hand-picked team of up to five staff, the primary purpose of the Kaihautū Wai Māori o Ngāti Awa position is to advance, enact, manage, promote, integrate, and facilitate achievement of Te Rūnanga o Ngāti Awa objectives its Te Māhere Rautaki Wai Māori o Ngāti Awa Project, including:

Developing a Ngāti Awa mauri assessment framework with Mauri Monitoring methodologies
Piloting the Mauri Management Framework in the field to gather baseline data
Updating the Ngāti Awa Environmental Policy Framework. the Matauranga and Freshwater Education programme to facilitate knowledge transmission
Researching key historical and cultural information on Ngāti Awa freshwater matauranga

This role will see you managing, planning, budgeting, recruiting, implementing, and working with nga uri o Ngāti Awa hapū, their delegates, and communities with the support of TRONA Taiao and ESR and BOPRC Scientists.

Put your experience of the Resource Management Act 1991, the NZ National Policy Statement for Freshwater Management 2020 and your understanding of the Principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the Mataatua Declaration on Water 2002 to work in this amazing project.

The keys to success of your application will be your:

Relevant tertiary qualifications and experience in Resource & Environmental Management Planning
Understanding of kaupapa Māori & te reo is preferable
Proven and compassionate people leadership skills
Outstanding communication skill, to ensure the vision for the project is understood
Strong listening skills will be required for the observation process
Strong writing ability to cater to policy planners
The ability to deal with potential conflict situations

If this role sounds like you, please contact Catherine Smith, Lead Recruitment Consultant at HR Connect at catherine.smith@hrconnect.co.nz or simply apply below.

Our team
The Data and Analytics team is a progressive group of diverse and creative individuals with a deep love for all things data-related. They build platforms and solutions that are leading edge and at the forefront of the technology curve. A close-knit and fun team embedded within our rapidly growing Professional Services division, and part of the wider Datacom ecosystem. This role can be based anywhere, so you choose your lifestyle and we have the role for you.
About the Role
We’re looking for Senior Data Engineers to join our growing analytics team and work on a broad range of customer projects with one common denominator – data. You’ll be working closely with our software developers, data scientists, DW engineers and data storytellers and will be responsible for creating and maintaining data architectures that enables data driven insights and innovation for our customers. In short, you’ll be building modern data platforms and get to work with cutting-edge data technologies in an Agile and fast-paced environment.
What you’ll do

Design data platforms, distributed systems, data lakes & data stores
Creating software solutions for data ingest & integration
Developing and operationalising reliable data pipelines & ETL patterns
Building analytics tools to provide actionable insights and solve business problems
Infrastructure development
Wrangling and integrating data from multiple sources
Identifying ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Technical skills

Experience in Snowflake/DBT
Strong programming skills, especially Python, Java, Scala, C++, C# etc
Cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS & GCP
Relational database management systems such as SQL Server, Redshift etc
Distributed processing technologies such as Apache Spark
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable data stores.
Experience building CI/CD Pipelines such as GITHUB, Azure DevOps, etc

Required Skills and Qualification

Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or related field
Experience developing and deploying data pipelines into live environments
A passion for lean, clean and maintainable code
Strong analytic skills related to working with datasets, both structured and unstructured
Curious and enthusiastic mindset
The desire to grow and to share insights with others

Helpful Knowledge

The desire to grow and to share insights with others
Machine Learning frameworks and theory
Analytic platforms & tools such as Databricks, Alteryx, SAS, KNIME or Datarobot
Data vault / Kimball modelling methodology
DevOps / DataOps

Why you want to join us...
Here at Datacom, It's the People! We are caring and humble and foster an environment where we can bring our best selves to work. Our people make the difference.
A value we hold strong, it's our fantastic team that’s testament to the continued success of our business.
Your career and continued learning and development are front and center of conversations in our teams. If you choose a technical career focus, or leadership and supporting people is your thing, we have a pathway that will help you achieve these goals! Not to mention an amazing team of experienced mentors to support you getting there. We have a leadership framework created for people through all stages of their career journeys.
Datacom’s reputation has been shaped by investing in our people, our culture, and, ultimately, our clients. We can offer the most exciting customer opportunities, whilst ensuring stability, opportunity, and great benefits!
Through challenging times recently and last year, where we have seen the Nation locked down, we carry on, working remotely, and in more ‘normal’ times we offer the flexibility and benefits of a hybrid working model. We’ve even continued to thrive and grow through these times!
If the role sounds like you and you’re keen to join our fantastic team, apply online today!

Requirements:
Datacom is committed to the health and safety of its people and the wider community. Based on our site access requirements for this role, and/or potential customer site and customer’s vaccination requirements which are constantly developing, the successful applicant will need to be able produce evidence of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or a valid exemption. Datacom will consider whether any accommodations can be made for candidates who are partially vaccinated (with remaining vaccine doses booked), or who are unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and hold a valid exemption. At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

The Opportunity

AECOM is growing and we are looking for solutions focussed Senior Mechanical Engineers to join our established Building Services team. In this role, you will provide specialist mechanical design solutions and offer expert technical advice to our clients on a diverse range of projects such as Data Centres, Commercial, Residential, Defence and Healthcare.

As a technical expert, you will assist in the development of proposals to support new opportunities and provide coaching and mentoring to junior engineers. These roles are ideal for mechanical engineers who thrives on working in a fast-paced environment and enjoy delivering creative and innovative solutions.

You will be working alongside driven professionals across various end-markets who are passionate, smart, creative, curious and quirky who are proud to be part of a company that is dedicated to delivering a better world.

Salary range for this role is $95 - 115k p.a. + benefits. Flexible working pattern including start/finish times and working from home. Ideally we are looking for someone full-time (40 hours per week) but we are open to part-time (30 hours per week) to support and encourage work/life balance.

Minimum Requirements


5+ years of solid mechanical engineering experience, ideally in a consulting environment
Knowledge of design and analysis of mechanical piping and distribution systems including equipment selections
Familiar with HVAC and building codes and standards
Good understanding of Revit
Experience working across a variety of market sectors i.e. industrial, commercial, healthcare, education etc.

Preferred Qualifications

+ Tertiary qualification in Mechanical Engineering

+ Post graduate qualifications will be advantageous

+ Chartered Engineer (or working towards)

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. Show more

Company : Worley
Primary Location
: NZL-CB-Christchurch
Job
: Project Management
Schedule
: Full-time
Employment Type : Employee
Job Level : Manager
Job Posting
: Aug 3, 2022
Unposting Date
: Sep 3, 2022
Reporting Manager Title : Division Manager - Christchurch
:
We have 48,000 of the world’s brightest minds in energy, chemicals and resources, all working to deliver a more sustainable world.
We are a worldwide team of project professionals, consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists all with one thing in common: we love to be challenged. Every day, we come to work to solve the complexity of the energy, chemicals and resources sectors.
What we do - We turn concepts into realities, blueprints into assets and ideas into energy. We deliver projects and provide engineering, procurement and construction expertise. Thanks to our range of services and the scope of our expertise, we work with our customers at every stage of their project: from initial concepts to sustaining and enhancing their assets.
Worley is recognised as New Zealand’s leading provider of industrial design, build and maintenance services. We provide the career challenges, project scope and professional opportunities you simply won’t find anywhere else. We can offer you the opportunity to develop projects and a work environment where your colleagues are professional and have a “can do” attitude.
We are seeking a smart, energetic and capable Senior Project Engineer or Project Manager who has experience delivering projects within the industrial sector. This could include dairy, food and beverage, heavy industrial, natural resources, ports, terminals or energy. You will be part of an experienced and supportive team involved in variety of industries.
To be successful you will:
Be an experienced Project Engineer or Manager with either a mechanical, electrical, civil/structural or process engineering degree and strong knowledge of project management processes, tools and techniques
Have 10+ years experience in project delivery
Have strong interpersonal and communication skills
Be experienced in supporting proposal, tenders and contract negotiations
Possess excellent written, oral and presentation skills supported with high computer literacy
You will form a part of a thriving team in our Christchurch office and be supported by our head office and wider global business.
Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success.

About Serko
Serko is an NZX50, global business travel and expense company, with our Headquarters based in Parnell, Auckland. As the 2020 HI-Tech Company of the Year, we're a SaaS that is diverse, close-knit group where everyone's opinion matters. We’re already the established leader in Australasia and revolutionizing the way people do business travel in the USA and Europe – and we’re growing!
Our purpose is to "Bring People Together", coupled with a vision to "Create a Connected, Frictionless Travel Experience". While the world of business travel is changing, we’re preparing companies for this with intelligent technology that helps them ensure the continued safety and wellbeing of their travelers.
Our mission is to "Build the World's Leading Business Travel Marketplace"! We’re backed by the likes of Booking.com and there is an exciting road ahead of us at a time where travel needs real, impactful change. We’re hiring people from different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to help us build a world-class team and product.
Requirements
We are searching for professional JavaScript / TypeScript engineers to take an integral part in building a cross-platform web application used by hundreds of thousands of users worldwide on iOS, Android and desktop platforms. This can be an excellent opportunity growing into a leadership role and owing it from end to end.
You’ll work within the Product team to build innovative, robust, scalable solutions using React, Typescript, and Azure. That will see you collaborating with the lead developer, frontend/backend engineers, DevOps, data scientists, QAs, designers, business analysts, project managers, and the product lead.
We put data at the heart of our product development process. User research, data science models and A/B tests inform our decisions and help us prioritize product iterations.
You will bring the following to the table
Significant experience in designing and building tools and maintaining a range of products within a platform of integrated services.
Significant understanding of the interconnection of services/products that supports a comprehensive platform.
Ability to produce timely, high-quality products, whilst also mentoring team members in the production of technology.
Significant demonstrated skill in the translation of complex technical systems into simple language and ability to consult with team members who may not have the knowledge or experience in technology, providing clear technical solutions.
Developer with strong experience in front end stack (TypeScript or JavaScript, NodeJS Express, React).
Some experience with A/B testing
Benefits
It's important to us that our people can bring their whole selves to work. Join our team and we have the following on offer for you!
Competitive salary + Kiwisaver + Life Insurance + A generous employee incentive share scheme
Laptop & tools, modern office with games, exceptional coffee, snacks, and a great social atmosphere!
Flexibility to work-from-home and with starting and finishing times
Extended leave benefits:
Promotional opportunities among an established & growing global organisation
1:1's to help focus on your personal growth via multiple career pathways
Access to discounted: Free flu shots, and confidential support, guidance, and counselling services with EAP
Inclusive culture which embraces the diversity of our people - with many different nationalities proudly represented across the Serko workforce. We look for people to add to our culture!
How to Apply
Serko is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer. However, due to Covid-19 immigration restrictions, we can only accept applications from candidates who are either NZ/AU citizens/permanent residents or hold a current valid work visa for employment in New Zealand.
Check out our other great opportunities & video footage about life a Serko, at www.serko.com/careers

Significant understanding of the interconnection of services/products that supports a comprehensive platform.
Ability to produce timely, high-quality products, whilst also mentoring team members in the production of technology.
Significant demonstrated skill in the translation of complex technical systems into simple language and ability to consult with team members who may not have the knowledge or experience in technology, providing clear technical solutions.
Developer with strong experience in front end stack (TypeScript or JavaScript, NodeJS Express, React).
Some experience with A/B testing
Benefits
It's important to us that our people can bring their whole selves to work. Join our team and we have the following on offer for you!
Competitive salary + Kiwisaver + Life Insurance + A generous employee incentive share scheme
Laptop & tools, modern office with games, exceptional coffee, snacks, and a great social atmosphere!
Flexibility to work-from-home and with starting and finishing times
Extended leave benefits:
Promotional opportunities among an established & growing global organisation
1:1's to help focus on your personal growth via multiple career pathways
Access to discounted: Free flu shots, and confidential support, guidance, and counselling services with EAP
Inclusive culture which embraces the diversity of our people - with many different nationalities proudly represented across the Serko workforce. We look for people to add to our culture!
How to Apply
Serko is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer. However, due to Covid-19 immigration restrictions, we can only accept applications from candidates who are either NZ/AU citizens/permanent residents or hold a current valid work visa for employment in New Zealand.

If this sounds like you, then please click on the "Apply" button and follow the prompts. About Serko
Serko is an NZX50, global business travel and expense company, with our Headquarters based in Parnell, Auckland. As the 2020 HI-Tech Company of the Year, we're a SaaS that is diverse, close-knit group where everyone's opinion matters. We’re already the established leader in Australasia and revolutionizing the way people do business travel in the USA and Europe – and we’re growing!
Our purpose is to "Bring People Together", coupled with a vision to "Create a Connected, Frictionless Travel Experience". While the world of business travel is changing, we’re preparing companies for this with intelligent technology that helps them ensure the continued safety and wellbeing of their travelers.
Our mission is to "Build the World's Leading Business Travel Marketplace"! We’re backed by the likes of Booking.com and there is an exciting road ahead of us at a time where travel needs real, impactful change. We’re hiring people from different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to help us build a world-class team and product.
Requirements
We are searching for professional JavaScript / TypeScript engineers to take an integral part in building a cross-platform web application used by hundreds of thousands of users worldwide on iOS, Android and desktop platforms. This can be an excellent opportunity growing into a leadership role and owing it from end to end.
You’ll work within the Product team to build innovative, robust, scalable solutions using React, Typescript, and Azure. That will see you collaborating with the lead developer, frontend/backend engineers, DevOps, data scientists, QAs, designers, business analysts, project managers, and the product lead.
We put data at the heart of our product development process. User research, data science models and A/B tests inform our decisions and help us prioritize product iterations.
You will bring the following to the table:
Significant experience in designing and building tools and maintaining a range of products within a platform of integrated services.
Significant understanding of the interconnection of services/products that supports a comprehensive platform.
Ability to produce timely, high-quality products, whilst also mentoring team members in the production of technology.
Significant demonstrated skill in the translation of complex technical systems into simple language and ability to consult with team members who may not have the knowledge or experience in technology, providing clear technical solutions.

job_title: Product Marketing Specialist- Medical Lab Experience Valued!
listing_jobDesc:
Amazing opportunity for a Lab Scientist with aptitude to expand into Marketing.
Work with one of NZ's best Tech Specialists in this Sector.
Great company culture & potential for long term career progression!


About the company

Our client is part of a global health-tech company that supplies innovative digital health solutions to more than 190 countries. With more than 73 offices and 10,000 staff around the world you will be part of a worldwide effort to continually advance healthcare diagnostics and IT systems. In NZ they are known for their range of clinical and lab information systems as well as In-Vitro Diagnostic (IVD) Devices.


About the role


This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with Lab experience who wants to develop a career in Health IT where you will interface with the sales, development & project management teams assisting in driving business opportunities through initiatives including partnering with teams to execute KPI’s, creating video content, planning workshops & marketing to the current/potential client base.


Key Responsibilities

Develop annual product marketing plans
Develop communication plans for brand presence and product marketing
Maintain and improve digital marketing presence
Provide Pre-Sales support through product demonstrations/presentations
Develop product marketing collateral and press releases
Facilitate user groups and product workshops to educate customers, gain feedback and to generate insights for potential product development.


What you’ll bring to the role

A tertiary qualification in Medical Sciences and/or Health Informatics, with business/marketing experience.
Experience within the Healthcare industry and an understanding of Digital Health.
An appreciation of how software can add value to lab data.
Great written and oral skills & an aptitude for learning.
Strong relationship, customer service and communication skills


Benefits

A competitive salary plus additional benefits, including medical, life and income protection insurances
Company mobile phone & laptop etc
Flexible hours and the ability to work from home three days a week
Super Newmarket location - a central hub for public transport
A personalised training programme to advance your skills and knowledge
Be mentored by a proven senior leader


How to apply


Click APPLY or contact Apiksha on apiksha@scitex.co.nz referring to 19/2206/AK for a confidential discussion.


To apply for this vacancy you MUST be a New Zealand citizen, resident, or have already secured the right to work in New Zealand and therefore hold a valid visa.


Scitex specialises in permanent, contract and temporary recruitment - and has done since 1987. We are here to engineer better Mondays. We love connecting talented people with great work opportunities in workplaces where you can thrive and make a meaningful difference.
